object.name: 1 Overarching
object.notes: $OV$The Overarching Section contains Conformance Criteria that apply to all EHR Systems and consequently must be included in all EHR-S FM compliant profiles. These criteria are grouped under a single Function.All functions within the Overarching Section have an identifier starting with “O”.$EX$$AC$

object.name: OV.1 Overarching Criteria
object.notes: $ST$Overarching criteria are those that apply to all EHR Systems.$DE$The Overarching Section contains Conformance Criteria that apply to all EHR Systems and consequently must be included in all EHR-S FM compliant profiles. These criteria are grouped under a single Function.$EX$

object.name: OV.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.9.1 (Produce a Summary Record of Care).

object.name: OV.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.9.3 (Health Record Output).

object.name: OV.1#03
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.9.4 (Standard Report Generation).

object.name: OV.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function RI.1.1 (Record Lifecycle) and all child functions.

object.name: OV.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function RI.1.2 (Record Lifespan) and all child functions.

object.name: OV.1#06
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function RI.2 (Record Synchronization).

object.name: OV.1#07
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function RI.3 (Record Archive and Restore).

object.name: OV.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.1 (Entity Authentication).

object.name: OV.1#09
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.2 (Entity Authorization) .

object.name: OV.1#10
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.3 (Entity Access Control).

object.name: OV.1#11
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.4 (Patient Access Management).

object.name: OV.1#12
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.5 (Non-Repudiation).

object.name: OV.1#13
object.notes: IF the system transmits data to or receives data from a system outside of a secure network, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.1.6 (Secure Data Exchange), to ensure that the data are protected.

object.name: OV.1#14
object.notes: IF the system transmits data to or receives data from a system outside of a secure network, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.1.7 (Secure Data Routing), to ensure that the exchange occurs only among authorized senders and receivers.

object.name: OV.1#15
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.1.8 (Patient Privacy and Confidentiality).

object.name: OV.1#16
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.2 (Audit) and all child functions.

object.name: OV.1#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function TI.3 (Registry and Directory Services).

object.name: OV.1#18
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.4 (Standard Terminology and Terminology Services).

object.name: OV.1#19
object.notes: IF the system manages data for which standard terminologies have been established, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.4.1 (Standard Terminologies and Terminology Models) to support semantic interoperability.

object.name: OV.1#20
object.notes: IF the system manages data for which standard terminologies have been established, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.4.2 (Maintenance and Versioning of Standard Terminologies) to preserve the semantics of coded data over time.

object.name: OV.1#21
object.notes: IF terminology mapping is implemented within the system, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.4.3 (Terminology Mapping).

object.name: OV.1#22
object.notes: IF the system receives or transmits data for which jurisdictionally established interchange standards exist, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.5.1 (Application and Structured-Document Interchange Standards) to support interoperability.

object.name: OV.1#23
object.notes: IF the system receives and transmits data for which generally accepted interchange standards have been established, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.5.2 (Interchange Standards Versioning and Maintenance), to accommodate the inevitable evolution of interchange standards.

object.name: OV.1#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function TI.5.3 (Standards-based Application Integration).

object.name: OV.1#25
object.notes: IF the system receives and transmits data with other systems outside itself, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.5.4 (Interchange Agreements), to define how the sender and receiver will exchange data.

object.name: OV.1#26
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function TI.6 (Business Rules Management).

object.name: OV.1#27
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function TI.7 (Workflow Management).

object.name: OV.1#28
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.8 (Database Backup and Recovery).

object.name: OV.1#29
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function TI.9 (System Management Operations and Performance).

object.name: OV.2 Manage User Help
object.notes: $ST$Support the ability to manage the configuration and/or customization of appropriate user help that is context sensitive and may include the exchange of live online chat.$DE$Throughout the system it is necessary to provide configurable, context sensitive and/or searchable user help to assist in the use of the system. User help levels should be configurable based on user requirements, scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law. User Help may include the live online chat support.$EX$

object.name: OV.2#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the configuration and customization of User Help in accordance with user requirements, and according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: OV.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD receive queries and render responses for data entry and system navigation assistance (User Help).

object.name: OV.2#03
object.notes: The system MAY exchange User Help queries and responses via live online chat.

object.name: OV.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD render context-sensitive invokable help to guide users through activities in the system (e.g. charting steps, menu navigation).

object.name: 2 Care Provision
object.notes: $OV$The Care Provision Section contains those functions and supporting Conformance Criteria that are required to provide direct care to a specific patient and enable hands-on delivery of healthcare. The functions are general and are not limited to a specific care setting and may be applied as part of an Electronic Health Record supporting healthcare offices, clinics, hospitals and specialty care centers. The functions in this section are organized in general flow of an encounter; however, it is recognized that encounter flow varies considerably in different care settings and scopes of practice. All functions within the Care Provision Section have an identifier starting with “CP”.$EX$For example, when a child presents with symptoms of common cold, a Direct Care EHR-S Function will enable the doctor to record that event. Additionally, Clinical decision-support functions within the Direct Care EHR-S section will alert the provider that a vaccination is due and will offer contraindication alerts for the medication given to the child who has symptoms of a cold.$AC$The principal users of these functions are expected to be authorized healthcare providers; the patient and/or subject of care will have access to certain functions to view, update or make corrections to their Electronic Health Record. The provider will receive appropriate decision support, as well as support from the EHR-S to enable effective electronic communication between providers, and between the provider and the patient/parent/caregiver.

object.name: CP.1 Manage Clinical History
object.notes: $ST$Manage the patient's clinical history lists used to present summary or detailed information on patient health history.$DE$Patient Clinical History lists are used to present succinct “snapshots” of critical health information including patient history; allergy intolerance and adverse reactions; medications; problems; strengths; immunizations; medical equipment/devices; and patient and family preferences.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.1 Manage Patient History
object.notes: $ST$Manage medical, procedural/surgical, mental health, substance use, social and family history. This includes pertinent positive and negative histories, patient-reported or externally available patient clinical history.$DE$The history of the current illness and patient historical data related to previous medical diagnoses, surgeries and other procedures performed on the patient, clinicians involved in procedures or in past consultations, and relevant health conditions of family members is captured through such methods as patient reporting (for example interview, medical alert band) or electronic or non-electronic historical data. This data may take the form of a pertinent positive such as "The patient/family member has had..." or a pertinent negative such as "The patient/family member has not had..." When first seen by a health care provider, patients typically bring with them clinical information from past encounters. This and similar information may supplement locally captured documentation and notes wherever appropriate.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage current patient history including pertinent positive and negative elements, and information on clinicians involved.

object.name: CP.1.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.2.1 (Support Externally Sourced Clinical Documents) to capture, store and render previous external patient histories.

object.name: CP.1.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.2.2 (Support Externally Sourced Clinical Data) to capture, store and render previous external patient histories.

object.name: CP.1.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture family history.

object.name: CP.1.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture social history.

object.name: CP.1.1#06
object.notes: The systems SHALL provide the ability to capture as part of the patient history the patient's relationships (e.g. genealogic, living situation, other)

object.name: CP.1.1#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture structured data in the patient history.

object.name: CP.1.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL maintain and render documentation made in a non-linear temporal sequence.

object.name: CP.1.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present multiple levels of data (log view versus readable view) versus not display at all.

object.name: CP.1.1#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture patient history according to a standards-based and coded form or template.

object.name: CP.1.1#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture an indication of the patient's receipt of social subsidies.

object.name: CP.1.2 Manage Allergy, Intolerance and Adverse Reaction List
object.notes: $ST$Manage patient-specific allergy, intolerance and adverse reaction lists.$DE$Allergens, including immunizations, and substances are identified and coded (whenever possible) and the list is captured and maintained over time. All pertinent dates, including patient-reported events, are stored and the description of the patient allergy and adverse reaction is modifiable over time. The entire allergy history, including reaction, for any allergen is viewable. The list(s) includes all reactions including those that are classifiable as a true allergy, intolerance, side effect or other adverse reaction to drug, food or environmental triggers. Notations indicating whether item is patient reported and/or provider verified are maintained.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage true allergy, intolerance, and adverse reaction to drug, food or environmental triggers as unique, discrete entries.

object.name: CP.1.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the reason for entry or maintenance (including update or remove) of the allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction.

object.name: CP.1.2#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the reaction type as discrete data.

object.name: CP.1.2#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the severity of an allergic or adverse reaction as discrete data.

object.name: CP.1.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage a report of No Known Allergies (NKA) for the patient.

object.name: CP.1.2#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage a report of No Known Drug Allergies (NKDA) for the patient.

object.name: CP.1.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the source of allergy, intolerance, and adverse reaction information.

object.name: CP.1.2#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag as deactivated an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction.

object.name: CP.1.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture as discrete data the reason for deactivation of an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction.

object.name: CP.1.2#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render allergies, intolerances and adverse reactions that have been deactivated.

object.name: CP.1.2#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render the list of allergies, intolerances and adverse reactions in a user defined sort order.

object.name: CP.1.2#12
object.notes: The system MAY restrict the ability to render the list in a user defined sort order.

object.name: CP.1.2#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag that the list of medications and other agents has been reviewed.

object.name: CP.1.2#14
object.notes: They system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render the date on which allergy information was entered.

object.name: CP.1.2#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render the approximate date of the allergy occurrence.

object.name: CP.1.2#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage allergy information as coded data.

object.name: CP.1.2#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain the required documentation of allergies prior to completion of the medication order.

object.name: CP.1.2#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render that the allergies are “Unknown” or “Unable to Assess Allergies".

object.name: CP.1.2#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the reason for “Unknown” or “Unable to Assess Allergies” documentation.

object.name: CP.1.2#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag records and render to providers that the allergies are “Unknown” or “Unable to Assess Allergies” and need to be updated.

object.name: CP.1.2#21
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture free text allergies and render them in a manner that distinguishes them from coded allergy entries.

object.name: CP.1.2#22
object.notes: The system SHOULD tag and render an indicator that interaction checking will not occur against free text allergies.

object.name: CP.1.2#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render historical allergy information.

object.name: CP.1.2#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link allergic reactions to specific treatment or diagnostic protocols.

object.name: CP.1.2#25
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.4.2.1 (Support for Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking) to render any potential interactions when capturing or maintaining allergies, intolerances or adverse reactions.

object.name: CP.1.2#26
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture information that a provider was presented with and acknowledged a drug interaction notification.

object.name: CP.1.3 Manage Medication List
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain patient-specific medication lists.$DE$Medication lists are managed over time, whether over the course of a visit or stay, or the lifetime of a patient. All pertinent dates, including medication start, modification, and end dates are stored. The entire medication history for any medication, including alternative supplements and herbal medications, is viewable. Medication lists are not limited to medication orders recorded by providers, but may include, for example, pharmacy dispense/supply records, patient-reported medications and additional information such as age specific dosage.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage a patient-specific medication list based on current medication orders or prescriptions.

object.name: CP.1.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the details of the medication information including prescriber, ordering date, dose, route, and SIG (description of the prescription, such as the quantity) formulation and instructions according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.1.3#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete data, medication information including prescriber, ordering date, dose, route, and SIG (description of the prescription, such as the quantity) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.1.3#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture other dates associated with medications such as start , end and discontinuation dates.

object.name: CP.1.3#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture medications not reported on existing medication lists or medication histories.

object.name: CP.1.3#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture non-prescription medications including over the counter and complementary medications such as vitamins, herbs and supplements.

object.name: CP.1.3#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the medication history associated with a patient.

object.name: CP.1.3#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag a medication as erroneously captured and excluded from the presentation of current medications.

object.name: CP.1.3#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render a current medication list for patient use.

object.name: CP.1.3#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render information regarding the filling of prescriptions.

object.name: CP.1.3#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render information regarding the dispensing of prescriptions.

object.name: CP.1.3#12
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to receive from an external source (for example a plan, payer or pharmacy) a medication history.

object.name: CP.1.3#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture that a medication history is unavailable or incomplete.

object.name: CP.1.3#14
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture a description and reason for a medication when the medication name is unknown.

object.name: CP.1.3#15
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render on the medication list active medications that the patient brings from home to take while hospitalized, which the Pharmacy may not dispense.

object.name: CP.1.3#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain the medication list with changes from pharmacist verification including pharmacist, date, and time.

object.name: CP.1.3#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the reason or indication for the medication when recording historical or medications from external sources (e.g. from home or other provider).

object.name: CP.1.3#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update a medication order directly from the medication list.

object.name: CP.1.3#19
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.1 (Support for Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking) to render any potential interactions when capturing or maintaining medications.

object.name: CP.1.3#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain a medication order directly from medication reconciliation.

object.name: CP.1.3#21
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture free text medications and render them in a manner that distinguishes them from coded medication entries.

object.name: CP.1.3#22
object.notes: The system SHALL tag and render an indicator that interaction checking will not occur against free text medications.

object.name: CP.1.3#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render side effects of medications from the medication list that have been previously experienced by the patient.

object.name: CP.1.3#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render potential side effects of medications from the medication list.

object.name: CP.1.3#25
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render that the patient takes no medications.

object.name: CP.1.3#26
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render only current active medications (i.e. exclude prescriptions whose duration has been exceeded or end date has passed).

object.name: CP.1.3#27
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render non-active medications or prescriptions for inclusion in current medication screening.

object.name: CP.1.3#28
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture medication self-administration details including timestamps, observations, complications, and reason if medication dose was not taken.

object.name: CP.1.3#29
object.notes: The system MAY capture Investigational Product Exposure information including Start Date/time, End Date/Time, Dose Amount, Dose Unit, Study Treatment Name, Route, Formulation as discrete elements.

object.name: CP.1.3#30
object.notes: The system SHALL capture, maintain and present pre-admission medications.

object.name: CP.1.3#31
object.notes: The system SHALL present pre-admission medications at the time of discharge.

object.name: CP.1.3#32
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain, and present all pertinent details of the medication administration including medication name, strength, dose, route, time of administration, exceptions to administration, and administrator of the medication.

object.name: CP.1.4 Manage Problem List
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain patient- specific problem lists.$DE$A problem list may include, but is not limited to chronic conditions, diagnoses, or symptoms, injury/poisoning (both intentional and unintentional), adverse effects of medical care (e.g., drugs, surgical), functional limitations, visit or stay-specific conditions, diagnoses, or symptoms. Problem lists are managed over time, whether over the course of a visit or stay or the life of a patient, allowing documentation of historical information and tracking the changing character of problem(s) and their priority. The source (e.g. the provider, the system id, or the patient) of the updates should be documented. All pertinent dates are stored, including date noted or diagnosed, dates of any changes in problem specification or prioritization, and date of resolution. This might include time stamps, where useful and appropriate. The entire problem history for any problem in the list is viewable.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete data, all active problems associated with a patient.

object.name: CP.1.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL capture and render a history of all problems associated with a patient.

object.name: CP.1.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage relevant dates including the onset date and resolution date of problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the duration (chronic, acute/self-limiting, etc.) of a problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the source of the problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function RI.1.1.17 (Deprecate/Retract Record Entries) to enable the inactivation or deprecation of a problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to update a problem to re-activate a previously deactivated problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render the list in a user defined sort order.

object.name: CP.1.4#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link encounters, orders, medical equipment, prosthetic/orthotic devices, medications, and notes to one or more problems.

object.name: CP.1.4#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to link orders, medical equipment, prosthetic/orthotic devices, and medications to one or more codified problems.

object.name: CP.1.4#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture free text problems and render them in a manner that distinguishes them from coded problem entries.

object.name: CP.1.4#12
object.notes: The system SHALL tag and render an indicator that interaction checking will not occur against free text problems.

object.name: CP.1.4#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture a problem into the problem list using standardized coding schemas (e.g. ICD or SNOMED).

object.name: CP.1.4#14
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage free text comments associated with the problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#15
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage the severity of a problem using a standards based classification scheme.

object.name: CP.1.4#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link actions taken and outcomes with a problem.

object.name: CP.1.4#17
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage known genetically based illnesses according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law, and subject to patient's preferences and consent.

object.name: CP.1.4#18
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage a known single allele carrier status of a genetic trait or disease according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law, and subject to patient's preferences and consent.

object.name: CP.1.4#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link problems on the problem list, i.e. create hierarchies or nestings.

object.name: CP.1.4#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the linking of problems on the problem list, i.e. change hierarchies or nestings.

object.name: CP.1.5 Manage Strengths List
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain patient-specific strengths lists.$DE$A patient's strength (or positive factor) that may impact a patient's care or recovery may be recorded as part of the EHR to support the development of care plans and treatment options. Examples of strengths include family support, financial support or health insurance levels, good overall health (e.g. athlete) etc. An example of an active patient-specific strength is that of a child caring for an elderly parent during his/her summer break from college.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete data, all active patient-specific strengths.

object.name: CP.1.5#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the source of patient-specific strengths.

object.name: CP.1.5#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function RI.1.1.17 (Deprecate/Retract Record Entries) to enable the inactivation or deprecation of a patient-specific strength.

object.name: CP.1.5#04
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to update a patient-specific strength to re-activate a previously deactivated patient-specific strength.

object.name: CP.1.5#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to link encounters, orders, medications, notes to one or more patient-specific strengths.

object.name: CP.1.5#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture free text patient-specific strengths and render them in a manner that distinguishes them from coded patient-specific strength entries.

object.name: CP.1.5#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD tag and render an indicator that interaction checking will not occur against free text patient-specific strengths.

object.name: CP.1.5#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture a patient-specific strength into the patient-specific strengths list using standardized coding schemes (e.g., a standardized Nursing Diagnosis coding system).

object.name: CP.1.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage free text comments associated with a patient-specific strength.

object.name: CP.1.5#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link actions taken and outcomes with a patient-specific strength.

object.name: CP.1.6 Manage Immunization List
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain patient-specific and health care delivery organization administered immunization lists.$DE$Immunization lists are managed over time, whether over the course of a visit or stay, or the lifetime of a patient. Details of immunizations administered are captured as discrete data elements including date, type, manufacturer and lot number. The entire immunization history is viewable.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.6#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage all immunizations associated with a patient.

object.name: CP.1.6#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete data elements, data associated with any immunization given including date and time of administration, immunization type and series, lot number and manufacturer, dose and administration site or route, and administering provider.

object.name: CP.1.6#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete elements, data associated with any immunization withheld (including date and time, immunization type, series, exception reason and immunization-withholding provider).

object.name: CP.1.6#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a report of a patient's immunization history (e.g., for appropriate authorities such as schools, day-care centers or public health immunization registries) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.1.6#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the currently recommended date for an immunization booster dose with each immunization, if needed.

object.name: CP.1.7 Manage Medical Equipment, Prosthetic/Orthotic, Device List
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain a patient-specific list of medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable devices.$DE$Details of medical equipment, orthotic/prosthetic and/or devices are captured as discrete data elements including information such as device type, date issued, date implanted or manufactured, device model number, device serial/lot number, manufacturer, supplier, involved extremity, anatomical location, date of battery change, and other data elements which many be required to correctly identify and track the equipment/device. The list may link to external sources, such as the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), so that the provider may be alerted if the medical device is recalled. The entire equipment. prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable device list is renderable.$EX$

object.name: CP.1.7#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, as discrete data, a patient specific list of specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable devices.

object.name: CP.1.7#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render, as discrete data, the description of each instance of use of specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable device.

object.name: CP.1.7#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render the reason for each instance of use of specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable device.

object.name: CP.1.7#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render the specific type of specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable device.

object.name: CP.1.7#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture an indication of No Known specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, and/or implantable device for the patient.

object.name: CP.1.7#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render, as discrete data, information necessary to identify and track the equipment/device including, at a minimum: type, manufacturer, manufacture date, date implanted (or placed into service), model/serial number, and anatomical location and any unique device identifier (e.g. UDI in US).

object.name: CP.1.7#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag as deactivated and capture reason for deactivation, an entry in the list when the specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, or implantable device is no longer in use by the patient.

object.name: CP.1.7#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to update an entry in the list to re-activate a previously deactivated specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, or implantable device.

object.name: CP.1.7#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render a list of deactivated specialized medical equipment, medical prosthetic, orthotic, or implantable devices including the reason for deactivation.

object.name: CP.1.7#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture the date of the next scheduled equipment or device maintenance.

object.name: CP.1.7#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture equipment or device maintenance instructions.

object.name: CP.1.8 Manage Patient and Family Preferences
object.notes: $ST$Capture and maintain patient and family preferences.$DE$Patient and family preferences regarding issues such as language, religion, spiritual practices and culture – may be important to the delivery of care. It is important to capture these so that they will be available to the provider at the point of care. NOTE This function is focused on the capture and maintenance of facts on patient/family preferences. For issues related to death and dying see DC.1.3.2 (Manage Patient Advance Directives)$EX$

object.name: CP.1.8#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage patient preferences (e.g. language(s), religion, spiritual practices and cultural practices).

object.name: CP.1.8#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage family preferences (e.g. language(s), religion, spiritual practices and cultural practices).

object.name: CP.1.8#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to exchange patient and family preferences with a decision support system.

object.name: CP.1.8#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage, including rendering at appropriate decision points, patient and family preferences as they pertain to current and planned treatment plans and orders.

object.name: CP.1.8#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to integrate patient and family preferences with appropriate health education materials (e.g., dietary advice based on dietary preference).

object.name: CP.2 Render Externally Sourced Information
object.notes: $ST$Render documentation and data that has been captured from multiple external sources. $DE$Documentation and data relevant to the patient record can be captured from many external sources and should be rendered appropriately alongside other information in the patient record. External sources are those outside the EHR system, including clinical, administrative, and financial information systems, other EHR systems, Personal Health Record (PHR) systems, and data received through health information exchange networks.$EX$

object.name: CP.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render externally-sourced Information.

object.name: CP.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render references to externally-sourced Information.

object.name: CP.2#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to CPS.2 (Support Externally-sourced Information).

object.name: CP.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render images (e.g. radiographs, pictures, video/audio, waveforms) captured from external sources.

object.name: CP.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render tagged patient health information derived from administrative or financial data and the source of that data for use by authorized users.

object.name: CP.2.1 Manage Patient Originated Data
object.notes: $ST$Capture and explicitly label patient originated data, link the data source with the data, and support provider authentication for inclusion in patient health record as well as subsequent rendering of the information as part of the health record.$DE$It is critically important to be able to distinguish clinically authored and authenticated data from patient-originated data that is either provided by the patient for inclusion in the EHR or entered directly into the EHR by the patient from clinically authenticated data. Patients may provide data for entry into the health record or be given a mechanism for entering this data directly. Patient-originated data intended for use by providers will be available for their use.Data about the patient may be appropriately provided by: 1. the patient2. a surrogate (parent, spouse, guardian) or 3. an informant (teacher, lawyer, case worker). 4. devices (e.g. blood pressure/sugar monitors).An electronic health record may provide the ability for direct data entry by any of these. Patient-originated data may also be captured by devices and transmitted for inclusion into the electronic health record.Data entered by any of these must be stored with source information. A provider must authenticate patient-originated data included in the patient's legal health record. A provider must be able to indicate they have verified the accuracy of patient-originated data (when appropriate and when a verification source is available) for inclusion in the patient record.Such verification does not have to occur at each individual data field and can be at a higher level of the data.Data about the patient may be appropriately provided by: 1. the patient2. a surrogate (parent, spouse, guardian) or 3. an informant (teacher, lawyer, case worker). An electronic health record may provide the ability for direct data entry by any of these. Patient-originated data may also be captured by devices and transmitted for inclusion into the electronic health record.Data entered by any of these must be stored with source information. A provider must authenticate patient-originated data included in the patient's legal health record. A provider must be able to indicate they have verified the accuracy of patient-originated data (when appropriate and when a verification source is available) for inclusion in the patient record.Such verification does not have to occur at each individual data field and can be at a higher level of the data.$EX$

object.name: CP.2.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture patient- originated data and tag that data as such.

object.name: CP.2.1#02
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability for the patient to enter capture data directly, THEN the system SHALL tag the data as patient entered.

object.name: CP.2.1#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render patient-originated data.

object.name: CP.2.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability for an authorized user to annotate, but not alter, patient-originated data.

object.name: CP.2.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the patient to annotate, but not alter, provider-sourced data.

object.name: CP.2.1#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the patient or proxy to annotate patient-originated data.

object.name: CP.3 Manage Clinical Documentation
object.notes: $ST$Clinical Documentation must be managed including the capture of the documentation during an encounter, maintenance and appropriate rendering.$DE$Clinical documentation includes all documentation that the clinician may capture during the course of an encounter with the patient or relevant to the patient. This includes assessments, clinical measurements, clinical documents and notes, patient specific care and treatment plans. Management of clinical documentation also includes the acknowledgement and amendments of documentation provided by other providers.$EX$

object.name: CP.3.1 Conduct Assessments
object.notes: $ST$Create and maintain assessment information.$DE$During an encounter with a patient, the provider will conduct an assessment that is germane to the age, gender, developmental or functional state, medical and behavioral condition of the patient, such as growth charts, developmental profiles, and disease specific assessments. Wherever possible, this assessment should follow industry standard protocols although, for example, an assessment for an infant will have different content than one for an elderly patient. When a specific assessment does not exist, a new, locally-defined assessment can be created, using the format and data elements of similar assessments whenever possible. (NOTE: A new assessment may not necessarily be unique, since a facility may copy an assessment from another facility.)$EX$

object.name: CP.3.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage assessment templates for provider use in assessing patient condition according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage recognized-standard and/or locally-defined assessments according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage assessment information (e.g., age, gender, developmental state, and health condition) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage patient information captured using recognized-standard and/or locally-defined assessments according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage additional assessment information as the patient's medical condition changes.

object.name: CP.3.1#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link assessment information to a problem list according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit assessment information to an individual care plan according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to receive assessment information from external sources (e.g., laboratory results, and radiographic results) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to analyze and render assessment data compared with standardized curves (e.g., growth charts).

object.name: CP.3.1#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render appropriate assessment information as trends on a graph or a flowsheet.

object.name: CP.3.1#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit data to and from an assessment to a medication list.

object.name: CP.3.1#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to analyze assessment information using clinical prediction rules (e.g., the Glasgow Coma Score or Well's score) and render and store the results.

object.name: CP.3.1#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.3.1 (Support for Standard Assessments).

object.name: CP.3.1#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.3.2 (Support for Patient Context-Driven Assessments).

object.name: CP.3.1#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render prior versions of completed recognized-standard and/or locally-defined assessment information.

object.name: CP.3.1#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to analyze the schedule of mandated assessments, render a proposed schedule, and capture the assessment appointments.

object.name: CP.3.1#17
object.notes: The system MAY determine and render a proposed list of assessments based on context-related information (e.g., chief complaint, length of stay, abnormal vital signs, or response to medication).

object.name: CP.3.1#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, render and store assessment information and the final score as discrete data as appropriate.

object.name: CP.3.1#19
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render internal care plans, guidelines, and protocols appropriate to the EHR user’s scope of practice.

object.name: CP.3.1#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render external care plans, guidelines, and protocols appropriate to the EHR user’s scope of practice and/or organizational policy.

object.name: CP.3.1#21
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to compare elements of assessments captured by the clinician and those elements of assessments designated by the organization as best practice assessments and/or evidence-based resources.

object.name: CP.3.2 Manage Patient Clinical Measurements
object.notes: $ST$Capture and manage patient clinical measures, such as vital signs, as discrete patient data.$DE$Within the context of an episode of care, patient measures such as vital signs are captured and managed as discrete data to facilitate reporting and provision of care. Other clinical measures (such as expiratory flow rate, size of lesion, etc.) are captured and managed, and may be discrete data.$EX$

object.name: CP.3.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture patient vital signs including blood pressure, temperature, heart rate, and respiratory rate, as discrete elements of structured or unstructured data.

object.name: CP.3.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture other clinical measures (e.g., peak expiratory flow rate, size of lesions, oxygen saturation, height, weight, length, body mass index and severity of pain) as discrete elements of either structured or unstructured data.

object.name: CP.3.2#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine additional values within an assessment based on atomic elements (e.g., Body Mass Index based on height and weight).

object.name: CP.3.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to import or receive clinical measurements (e.g., bone density, bone age, cardiac rhythm) from an ancillary system or external device (e.g., Holter monitor) as discrete elements of either structured or unstructured data.

object.name: CP.3.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture mood and behavior and daily functioning as either structured or unstructured data.

object.name: CP.3.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render percentile values when data with normative distributions are entered.

object.name: CP.3.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine normal ranges for numeric, as well as normal values for non-numeric, data (e.g., presence or absence of physical findings based on developmental stage) based on age and other parameters such as height, weight, ethnicity or gestational age.

object.name: CP.3.2#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render target clinical measurement values indicated by public health and according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law (e.g., mean total blood cholesterol of 199 mg/dL).

object.name: CP.3.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture both the time the clinical measurement was taken as well as the time it was entered into the system.

object.name: CP.3.2#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render trends of clinical measurements.

object.name: CP.3.2#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render growth charts that include growth data (weight, length or height and head circumference) on a graph that includes normative data plotted against population-based normative curves by age ranges, gender and ethnicity of the respective normative data (e.g., females 0-36 months).

object.name: CP.3.2#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render the number of standard deviations from the mean when data with normative distributions are captured.

object.name: CP.3.2#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, store and render data using different units of measurement (e.g., grams, kilograms and pounds).

object.name: CP.3.2#14
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render clinical context for each data point on the growth chart (e.g., ventilated, receiving growth hormone, Tanner stage).

object.name: CP.3.2#15
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture maintain and render patient maturity level measurements (e.g., using the "Tanner Stage" method).

object.name: CP.3.2#16
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine post conceptional age (corrected age) for the purposes of decision support.

object.name: CP.3.3 Manage Clinical Documents and Notes
object.notes: $ST$Create, addend ,amend, correct, authenticate, maintain, present and close, as needed, transcribed or directly-entered clinical documentation and notes.$DE$Clinical documents and notes may be unstructured and created in a narrative form, which may be based on a template, graphic, audio, etc. The documents may also be structured documents that result in the capture of coded data. Each of these forms of clinical documentation is important and appropriate for different users and situations. To facilitate the management and documentation on how providers are responding to incoming data on orders and results, there may also be some free text or formal record on the providers’ responsibility and/or standard choices for disposition, such as Reviewed and Filed, Recall Patient, or Future Follow Up. The system may also provide support for documenting the clinician’s differential diagnosis process.$EX$

object.name: CP.3.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render clinical documentation (henceforth "documentation") including original, update by amendment in order to correct, and addenda.

object.name: CP.3.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture free text documentation.

object.name: CP.3.3#03
object.notes: The system MAY present documentation templates (structured or free text) to facilitate creating documentation.

object.name: CP.3.3#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to present other existing documentation within the patient's EHR while new creating documentation.

object.name: CP.3.3#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link documentation for a specific patient with a given event (e.g., office visit, phone communication, e-mail consult, lab result).

object.name: CP.3.3#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render the list in a user defined sort order (Ref: CP.1.4 [Manage Problem List] cc#8).

object.name: CP.3.3#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link encounters, orders, medical equipment, prosthetic/orthotic devices, medications, and notes to one or more problems (Ref: CP.1.4 [Manage Problem List] cc#9).

object.name: CP.3.3#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to update documentation prior to finalizing it.

object.name: CP.3.3#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag a document or note as final.

object.name: CP.3.3#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the author(s) and authenticator(s) of documentation when the documentation is rendered.

object.name: CP.3.3#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render documents based on document metadata (e.g., note type, date range, facility, author, authenticator and patient).

object.name: CP.3.3#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability for providers to capture clinical documentation using standard choices for disposition (e.g., reviewed and filed, recall patient, or future follow-up).

object.name: CP.3.3#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture, maintain and render the clinician’s differential diagnosis and the list of diagnoses that the clinician has considered in the evaluation of the patient.

object.name: CP.3.3#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render clinical documentation using an integrated charting or documentation tool (e.g., notes, flow-sheets, radiology views, or laboratory views).

object.name: CP.3.3#15
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture clinical documentation using specialized charting tools for patient-specific requirements (e.g., age - neonates, pediatrics, geriatrics; condition - impaired renal function; medication).

object.name: CP.3.3#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render transition-of-care related information.

object.name: CP.3.3#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag the status of clinical documentation (e.g., preliminary, final, signed).

object.name: CP.3.3#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag and render lists of patients requiring follow up contact (e.g., laboratory callbacks, radiology callbacks, left without being seen).

object.name: CP.3.3#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture patient follow-up contact activities (e.g., laboratory callbacks, radiology callbacks, left without being seen).

object.name: CP.3.4 Manage Patient-Specific Care and Treatment Plans
object.notes: $ST$Provide templates and forms for clinicians to use for care plans, guidelines and protocols during provision of care and care planning.$DE$During the provision of care, the clinician reviews and uses templates and forms to ensure consistent quality patient care. Care plans, guidelines or protocols may contain goals or targets for the patient, specific guidance to the providers, suggested orders, and nursing interventions, among other items, including alerts. Information such as Order sets for care plans may arrive from an external institution and need to be approved locally before being inserted into the care plan. Tracking of implementation or approval dates, modifications and relevancy to specific domains or context is provided. Transfer of treatment and care plans may be implemented electronically using, for example, templates, or by printing plans to paper. $EX$

object.name: CP.3.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage patient-specific plans of care and treatment.

object.name: CP.3.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.7.1 (Present Guidelines and Protocols for Planning Care) and provide the ability to render locally or non-locally developed templates, guidelines, and protocols for the creation of patient-specific plans of care and treatment.

object.name: CP.3.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render previously developed care plans as a basis for the creation of new plans of care and treatment.

object.name: CP.3.4#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture metadata regarding a patient’s plan of care or treatment (e.g., authors, creation date, version history, references, local sources and non-local sources) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.4#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link order sets with care plans.

object.name: CP.3.4#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link the Care Plan with condition(s) in Problem Lists.

object.name: CP.3.4#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render order sets from care plans.

object.name: CP.3.4#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render care plans from order sets.

object.name: CP.3.4#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to transmit care plans and treatment plans to other care providers.

object.name: CP.3.4#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.5.1 (Clinical Task Creation, Assignment and Routing) and integrate care plan items in the tasks assigned and routed.

object.name: CP.3.4#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.5.3 (Clinical Task Linking) and integrate care plan items in the tasks linked.

object.name: CP.3.4#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.5.3 (Clinical Task Status Tracking) and integrate care plan items in the tasks tracked.

object.name: CP.3.4#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.4.2.2 (Support for Patient Specific Dosing and Warnings) to determine and render related warnings on drug dosing and interactions.

object.name: CP.3.4#14
object.notes: The system MAY conform to function CPS.1.7.1 (Support for Patient and Family Preferences) to improve the effectiveness of care and treatment plans.

object.name: CP.3.4#15
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and render a care plan review schedule or conference schedule.

object.name: CP.3.4#16
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render, as discrete data, the reason for variation from rule-based clinical messages (e.g., alerts and reminders).

object.name: CP.3.4#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture that a patient should not be on a generally recommended care plan and the reason why.

object.name: CP.3.4#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture care processes across the continuum of care.

object.name: CP.3.4#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render care processes from across the continuum of care.

object.name: CP.3.5 Acknowledge/ Amend Other Provider Documentation
object.notes: $ST$Review and indicate or amend other caregiver notes as permitted according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.$DE$Scan/review notes from physicians, nurses, technicians and other members of the health care team (e.g. Respiratory Therapist, Physical Therapist). Annotate for disparities, make additions/amendments and import when desired and permitted.$EX$

object.name: CP.3.5#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag documentation by another clinician as read according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.5#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to tag agreement or disagreement with documentation by another provider according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.5#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability for a user (i.e., supervising clinician) to annotate regarding his/her role in advising and/or providing direct care according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.5#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render a co-signature of documentation that was captured by another user according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.3.5#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture the approval of documentation that was captured by another user according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4 Manage Orders
object.notes: $ST$Provide the ability to manage clinical orders and results including medication, non-medication, diagnostic tests, blood products, other biologics and referrals, using order sets as appropriate.$DE$The provision of clinical care includes the need to order from a variety of treatments using order sets as appropriate as well as reviewing the results of treatment. Orders for treatments may include medications, non-medication therapies (e.g. physical therapy, special diet, immunizations, non-allopathic regimens); diagnostic care (e.g., laboratory, radiology); blood products and other biologics (e.g., blood transfusions, human growth hormones). Patients are often referred to other health care providers for more specialized diagnostic workup and/or treatment. An effective EHR-S must include support and management of these processes and associated documentation.$EX$

object.name: CP.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage role-based, context-based and/or user-based order entry.

object.name: CP.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the creation, renewal, modification and discontinuation of orders.

object.name: CP.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render relevant, patient-specific laboratory test results when entering an order.

object.name: CP.4#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the status of an order (e.g. open, completed, in process).

object.name: CP.4#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture, maintain and render order entry with an appropriate registration process when the identity of the patient is unknown or in an urgent situation.

object.name: CP.4#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage standing orders or orders that may be submitted by providers other than licensed providers according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render problem/diagnosis as a required element of an order.

object.name: CP.4#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture, maintain and render, as discrete data, a diagnosis/problem code and/or description associated with an order of any type (including prescriptions and medications ordered for administration).

object.name: CP.4#09
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to link an order of any type (including medication order) with a related clinical problem(s) and/or diagnosis code(s) and description.

object.name: CP.4#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to annotate and render comments and instructions with an order.

object.name: CP.4#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to annotate and render free text comments and instructions with an order.

object.name: CP.4#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag frequently used and institutionally-approved order sets as “favorites” or “preferences” to facilitate retrieval and ordering.

object.name: CP.4#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage orders submitted to or received from external organizations and/or facilities such as Health Information Exchanges (HIE) or regional Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR-S).

object.name: CP.4#14
object.notes: The system SHALL render the patient name, identification number, and age or date of birth on all order screens.

object.name: CP.4#15
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render an indicator of oral verification ("read-back") of the complete order by the person receiving the telephone or verbal order.

object.name: CP.4#16
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render the urgency status (e.g., As-Soon-As-Possible or STAT) associated with an order.

object.name: CP.4#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render order history for any order, including the ordering clinician, order details, date, and time.

object.name: CP.4#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag and render a field as required for a complete order by order type.

object.name: CP.4#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag orders to be activated at a future date and time including admission orders, discharge orders, and post-operative orders.

object.name: CP.4#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render orders for all order types.

object.name: CP.4#21
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage conditional orders that can be activated when certain criteria and conditions are met.

object.name: CP.4#22
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, store and render the identity of all providers who signed an order.

object.name: CP.4#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a list of active orders for a patient.

object.name: CP.4#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a list of orders by similar or comparable type (e.g., all radiology or all laboratory orders).

object.name: CP.4#25
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render outstanding orders for multiple patients (as opposed to outstanding orders for a single patient).

object.name: CP.4#26
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the provider's order-cancellation request.

object.name: CP.4#27
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit an order-cancellation request.

object.name: CP.4#28
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.8.4 (Support for Communication between Provider and Patient and/or the Patient Representative) to manage information regarding orders.

object.name: CP.4.1 Use Order Sets
object.notes: $ST$Use Order Set templates to facilitate order entry by rendering the appropriate orders based on provider request, input or system configuration.$DE$Predefined order set templates may include medication and non-medication orders (e.g., diet, activities, nursing care, prescriptions and requests for investigations). They allow a care provider to choose common orders for a particular circumstance or disease state according to standards or other criteria such as provider preference. Recommended order set templates may be presented based on patient data or other contexts. Order Set templates may also allow the provider to modify (add/remove/change) orders during order entry for a particular patient.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture a set of actions and/or items to be ordered for a patient using a predefined order set template.

object.name: CP.4.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage a patient's orders as an order set.

object.name: CP.4.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a patient's orders as an order set.

object.name: CP.4.1#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to integrate patient information and order set templates to render orders.

object.name: CP.4.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.1 (Manage Order Set Templates).

object.name: CP.4.1#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render the appropriate order set template based on various contexts (e.g., by disease, care setting, or medications used).

object.name: CP.4.1#07
object.notes: The system MAY render order set templates to providers based on diagnoses, conditions, or symptoms to aid decision support.

object.name: CP.4.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and integrate in an order set, various types of orders for a patient (e.g., medications, laboratory tests, imaging studies, procedures and referrals).

object.name: CP.4.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to delete individual orders from an instance of an order set for an individual patient according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.1#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag as deleted an individual order(s) from an instance of an order set for an individual patient according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.1#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to integrate multiple order set templates, customizing and storing it as a new order set template according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.1#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link order set(s) with condition(s) on the patient's Problem List.

object.name: CP.4.2 Manage Medication Orders
object.notes: $ST$Create prescriptions or other medication orders with detail adequate for correct filling and administration. Provide information regarding compliance of medication orders with formularies. Provide drug utilization review functionality including alerts regarding drug interactions and allergies.$DE$Medications include prescribed and over the counter (OTC) drugs, allergy shots, oxygen, anesthetics, chemotherapy, and dietary supplements that were ordered, supplied, administered, or continued. Different medication orders, including new, discontinue, refill/continue, and renew require different levels and kinds of detail, as do medication orders placed in different situations. Administration or patient instructions are available for selection by the ordering clinicians, or the ordering clinician is facilitated in creating such instructions. The system may allow for the creation of common content for prescription details. Appropriate time stamps for all medication related activity are generated. This includes series of orders that are part of a therapeutic regimen, e.g. Renal Dialysis, Oncology. When it comes to capturing the medication rationale, it is not mandatory that the provider always provide this information). In addition, the system should present the clinician with clinical decision support functionality (such as the presentation of allergies, drug-drug- interactions) during the medication ordering process. When a clinician places an order for a medication, that order may or may not comply with a formulary specific to the patient’s location or insurance coverage, if applicable. Whether the order complies with the formulary should be communicated to the ordering clinician at an appropriate point to allow the ordering clinician to decide whether to continue with the order. Formulary-compliant alternatives to the medication being ordered may also be presented.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.2#01
object.notes: The System SHALL conform to CP.4.2.1 (Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking).

object.name: CP.4.2#02
object.notes: The System SHALL conform to CP.4.2.2 (Patient Specific Medication Dosing & Warnings).

object.name: CP.4.2#03
object.notes: The System SHALL conform to CP.4.2.3 (Medication Order Efficiencies).

object.name: CP.4.2#04
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to CP.4.2.4 (Medication Alert Overrides).

object.name: CP.4.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture medication order details as discrete data (e.g., for correct filling, dispensing and administration of drug, dose, route, duration, SIG).

object.name: CP.4.2#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to maintain and render as discrete data, medication orders including all the details adequate for correct filling, dispensing and administration. (e.g. Drug, dose, route, SIG)

object.name: CP.4.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture medication order details including dose, route, frequency and comments as free text.

object.name: CP.4.2#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage free text as part of a medication order or prescription (e.g., "this patient is unable to swallow large pills").

object.name: CP.4.2#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD render fixed text (e.g., "Bio-hazard Warning") as part of a medication order according to organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2#10
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and render a notification to the provider that information required to compute a dose is missing or invalid.

object.name: CP.4.2#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture patient's preference for medication usage (e.g., oral vs. injectable, generic vs. brand name) and present it to a provider at the time of medication ordering.

object.name: CP.4.2#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage prescriptions using fractional units of medications (e.g., 1/2 tsp., 1/2 tablet).

object.name: CP.4.2#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain documentation regarding patient weight, including such terms as "unknown", before entering medication orders.

object.name: CP.4.2#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the administrative or clinical reasons/indications/rationale for the medication(s) selected during order entry.

object.name: CP.4.2#15
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render the status (e.g., for outpatient medication ordering: captured, verified, filled, dispensed to patient; for inpatient: captured, verified, filled, administered) of a medication order.

object.name: CP.4.2#16
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and render the status of medication dispensing.

object.name: CP.4.2#17
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.1.3 (Manage Medication List) and update the appropriate medication list with the prescribed medications (in case of multiple medication lists).

object.name: CP.4.2#18
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to enter and maintain medication information brought in by the patient.

object.name: CP.4.2#19
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to electronically capture medication information brought in by the patient (e.g., scan in a bar code from an Rx label).

object.name: CP.4.2#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.4.2.4 (Support for Medication Recommendations).

object.name: CP.4.2#21
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to enter and maintain prescription information from an external source (e.g., transcribed information from a non-network provider) to fill or renew a prescription.

object.name: CP.4.2#22
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to receive and maintain prescription information from an external source (e.g., electronically from a non-network provider) to fill or renew a prescription.

object.name: CP.4.2#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage medication orders for uncoded and non-formulary medications.

object.name: CP.4.2#24
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to receive the patient's Current Medication List from Pharmacy (directly) or via an intermediary network.

object.name: CP.4.2#25
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to order supplies associated with medication orders according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2#26
object.notes: The system SHOULD render a list of frequently-used patient medication administration instructions and capture the ordering clinician's selection.

object.name: CP.4.2#27
object.notes: The system MAY render a list of medication administration instructions common to multiple orders for the patient, and capture the ordering clinician's selection.

object.name: CP.4.2#28
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient instructions that are linked to an ordered medication.

object.name: CP.4.2#29
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.9.2 (Support Financial Eligibility Verification) to capture and render the results of electronic prescription eligibility and health plan/payer formulary checking.

object.name: CP.4.2#30
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit a request for a patient's prescription drug insurance eligibility verification.

object.name: CP.4.2#31
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and capture co-signatures for orders based upon roles (i.e., consulting physician) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2#32
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage orders that contain discrete medication components to create combination drugs or compounds (e.g., Butalbital compound).

object.name: CP.4.2#33
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render prescriptions for limited re-printing, subject according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law (e.g., limited to three times).

object.name: CP.4.2#34
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render prescriptions for re-printing, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law (e.g., limited to three times).

object.name: CP.4.2#35
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render prescriptions for re-faxing, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law (e.g., limited to three times).

object.name: CP.4.2#36
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render the associated problem, diagnosis or condition (indication) on the printed prescription according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2#37
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a list of transmission options for a prescription/medication order to a specified pharmacy (e.g., printing, faxing, e-prescribing).

object.name: CP.4.2#38
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain, and present the patient's consent to have restricted medications administered (e.g., Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS) for research protocol and experimental drugs).

object.name: CP.4.2#39
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present information received through health plan/payer formulary checking (e.g., formulary alternatives, formulary status, co-pay and coverage types, prior authorization requirements, step therapy requirements, age limits, gender limits, quantity limits, age, gender, summary resource links and drug specific resource links).

object.name: CP.4.2#40
