object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render an indicator of an explicit route for the administration of specific medications during the ordering process.

object.name: CP.4.2#41
object.notes: The system SHOULD render available alternate medication administration routes during the medication ordering process when multiple routes exist and none was specified.

object.name: CP.4.2.1 Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking
object.notes: $ST$Provide alerts for potential medication interactions and medication allergy reactions.$DE$Check and provide alerts at the time of medication order based upon coded, active and non-active medications for possible interactions, allergies, and other reactions.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.2.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.1 (Support for Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking) to determine allergic reactions, drug-drug interactions, and other potential adverse reactions, and render alerts or notifications when new medications are ordered.

object.name: CP.4.2.1#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render an alert, at the time a new medication is prescribed/ordered, that drug interaction, allergy, and formulary checking will not be performed against uncoded or free text medication(s).

object.name: CP.4.2.1#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a notification at the time a new uncoded medication is prescribed/ordered that drug interaction, allergy, and formulary checking will not be performed, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render and tag as inactive recently inactivated medications for inclusion in current medication screening according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.2.2 Patient Specific Medication Dosing & Warnings
object.notes: $ST$Render medication dosing and warnings related to a medication order based on patient-specific parameters.$DE$Provide parameter based (e.g. weight, lean body mass, age, sensitivity, genomics, body surface area) medication dosing recommendations and warnings for simple medications and compounded medications at the time of order entry.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.2.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.2 (Support for Patient Specific Dosing and Warnings) to determine potential adverse reactions and render alerts or notifications when new medications are ordered.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render weight-specific dose suggestions and auto-populate (e.g., default) medication orders based on the suggested dosage.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture alternative patient dosing weight(s) (e.g. ideal body weight or dry weight vs. actual patient weight) for the purpose of dose calculation.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#04
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture alternative patient dosing weight(s), THEN the system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render alternative weight-specific dose recommendations and autopopulate medication orders based on the suggested dosage.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient-specific medication dosing recommendations based on the patient's age and weight/body surface area.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render patient-specific medication dosing recommendations based on previous patient experience (e.g., adverse reaction, type and severity) with the same medication.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine weight-based medication dosing when doses are based on the patient's weight (e.g., mg/kg).

object.name: CP.4.2.2#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and render medication orders in which the weight-specific dose suggested employs a starting range with incremental changes toward a target range (e.g., a target therapeutic index).

object.name: CP.4.2.2#09
object.notes: The system MAY render a notification requesting the parameters (e.g., coefficients, exponents, formulas) required to calculate the body surface area.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and present dose ranges based on patient age.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage complex medication orders that include dosing based on either physical status or laboratory values.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#12
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and present drug dosing based on custom compounded medication components.

object.name: CP.4.2.2#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage medication orders with patient-specific dose calculations (e.g., by weight, body surface area or genotype).

object.name: CP.4.2.3 Medication Order Efficiencies
object.notes: $ST$Provide the tooling necessary to increase the efficiency of medication ordering.$DE$Make medication ordering workflows more efficient by allowing medications to be sorted and reviewed by key attributes, e.g. generic or trade names. Also support editing medication orders across multiple instances of an order and capturing medication orders in order sets.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.2.3#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present a list of medications based on an attribute of the medication (e.g., partial medication name, therapeutic class, or formulary).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present a list of medications based on an attribute of the patient (e.g., proposed treatment, patient condition, order set, age, gender).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the clinician to edit medication administration instructions and link it to the corresponding instances of that medication order.

object.name: CP.4.2.3#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to extract, update and store a prescription renewal by allowing a prior prescription to be reordered without re-entering previous data (e.g. administration schedule, quantity, SIG).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to extract, update and store a prescription renewal from a prior prescription using the same dosage but allowing for editing of details adequate for correct filling and administration of medication (e.g. dose, frequency, body weight).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to extract, update and store a prescription renewal from a prior prescription using a different dosage but allowing for editing of details adequate for correct filling and administration of medication (e.g., dose, frequency, body weight).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#07
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to CP.4.1 (Use Order Sets).

object.name: CP.4.2.3#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to extract and render medications by generic and/or brand name.

object.name: CP.4.2.4 Medication Alert Overrides
object.notes: $ST$Capture the alerts and warnings for medications being over-ridden and reasons for the over-ride.$DE$Alerts are generated for possible contraindications to administration of medications (e.g., the administration of tetracycline to pregnant women) and the prescriber may choose to over-ride the alert.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.2.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to edit a medication order by overriding the drug alert or warning and transmitting the updated medication order.

object.name: CP.4.2.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture reasons for overriding a drug alert or warning (e.g., a drug dose warning) at the time of ordering.

object.name: CP.4.2.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag and render an indication that a provider has overridden a drug alert or warning (e.g., a drug dose warning).

object.name: CP.4.3 Manage Non-Medication Patient Care Orders
object.notes: $ST$Enable the origination, documentation, capture, transmission, tracking and maintenance of non-medication patient care orders.$DE$Non-medication orders that request actions or items can be captured and tracked including new, renewal and discontinue orders. Examples include orders to transfer a patient between units, to ambulate a patient, for medical supplies, wound care, durable medical equipment, home IV, and diet or therapy orders. Additionally, psychotherapy and other mental health counseling, other surgical and non-surgical procedures, and complementary alternative medicine are included in non-medication treatments. Each item ordered includes the appropriate detail, such as order identification and instructions. Orders should be communicated to the correct service provider for completion.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage non-medication patient care orders for an action or item.

object.name: CP.4.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render order detail for correct order fulfillment.

object.name: CP.4.3#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the status (e.g., active, discontinued, requisitioned, completed) of the ordered action or item.

object.name: CP.4.3#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to assign a future date for an ordered action or item.

object.name: CP.4.3#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture a set of patient instructions that will be provided to the patient for correct order fulfillment.

object.name: CP.4.3#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a set of patient instructions that will be provided to the patient for correct order fulfillment.

object.name: CP.4.3#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit the order to the recipient(s) for order fulfillment.

object.name: CP.4.3#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link non-medication orders to a medication order (e.g., ordering an intravenous pump in coordination with intravenous medication).

object.name: CP.4.3#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to store a task to be recurrent at a defined interval for a specified length of time.

object.name: CP.4.3#10
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.3 (Support for Non-Medication Ordering).

object.name: CP.4.4 Manage Orders for Diagnostic Tests
object.notes: $ST$Enable the origination, documentation, transmission, tracking and maintenance of orders for diagnostic tests.$DE$Orders for diagnostic tests (e.g. diagnostic radiology, laboratory) are captured and tracked including new, renewal and discontinue orders. Each order includes appropriate detail, such as order identification, instructions and clinical information necessary to perform the test. Orders and supporting detailed documentation shall be communicated to the service provider for completion of the diagnostic test(s).Some systems may contain instructions, but in some settings, instructions may be provided from external sources (e.g., handouts).$EX$

object.name: CP.4.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage orders for diagnostic tests.

object.name: CP.4.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render standard order detail for diagnostic test order fulfillment.

object.name: CP.4.4#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain user-created instructions and/or prompts when ordering diagnostic tests or procedures.

object.name: CP.4.4#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the status (e.g., requisitioned, completed, in process) of diagnostic test(s).

object.name: CP.4.4#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render patient instructions relevant to the diagnostic test ordered.

object.name: CP.4.4#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to transmit orders to the recipient (s) for order fulfillment of the diagnostic test.

object.name: CP.4.4#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit supporting detailed documentation to the recipient (s) for order fulfillment of the diagnostic test.

object.name: CP.4.4#08
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.3 (Support for Non-Medication Ordering).

object.name: CP.4.4#09
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit order activity to public health authorities according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.4#10
object.notes: IF subsequent orders are being captured, THEN the system SHOULD provide the ability to render prior diagnostic results for a given patient.

object.name: CP.4.4#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture and render complete demographic information for diagnostic orders according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.4.4#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to include an indication (e.g., clinical rationale, reason, link to Problem list) for ordering the test(s).

object.name: CP.4.5 Manage Orders for Blood Products and Other Biologics
object.notes: $ST$Communicate with appropriate sources or registries to manage orders for blood products or other biologics.$DE$Interact with a blood bank system or other source to support orders for blood products or other biologics including discontinuance orders. Use of such products in the provision of care is captured. Blood bank or other functionality that may come under jurisdictional law or other regulation (e.g. by the FDA in the United States) is not required; functional communication with such a system is required.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage orders for blood products and biological products.

object.name: CP.4.5#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the status (e.g., requisitioned, completed, in process) of blood product and/or biological product orders.

object.name: CP.4.5#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage storage request orders for blood products and/or biological products.

object.name: CP.4.5#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the status of storage request orders (e.g., requisitioned, completed, in process) for blood products and/or biological products.

object.name: CP.4.5#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.9.2 (Support for Inter-Provider Communication) to enable exchange of manage information regarding blood products and biological products between to members of the care team.

object.name: CP.4.5#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the use of blood products and other biologics in the provision of care.

object.name: CP.4.5#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage units for orders of blood products appropriate to age specific care (e.g., pediatric care such as ml/kg, “Pedi packs” and other aliquots).

object.name: CP.4.5#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage information associated with the collection and administration of non-blood biologics (e.g., breast milk products), including donor and recipient and/or patient-identifying data, aliquot-identifying data, amount, route (e.g., oral versus tube), expiration date and time of administration.

object.name: CP.4.6 Manage Orders for Referral
object.notes: $ST$Enable the origination, documentation and tracking of referrals between care providers or healthcare organizations, including clinical and administrative details of the referral, and consents and authorizations for disclosures as required.$DE$Documentation and tracking of a referral from one care provider to another is supported, whether the referred to or referring providers are internal or external to the healthcare organization. Guidelines for whether a particular referral for a particular patient is appropriate in a clinical context and with regard to administrative factors such as insurance may be provided to the care provider at the time the referral is created. The EHR-S provides the ability to receive and act upon referral responses from providers. The EHR-S may provide the ability to capture completion of the referral appointment.$EX$

object.name: CP.4.6#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage outbound referral(s), whether internal or external to the organization.

object.name: CP.4.6#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture clinical details necessary for the referral according to the scope of practice of the referral recipient.

object.name: CP.4.6#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to link (e.g. link to image stored in PACS) clinical details as necessary for the referral according to the scope of practice of the referral recipient.

object.name: CP.4.6#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render clinical details as necessary for the referral according to the scope of practice of the referral recipient.

object.name: CP.4.6#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture administrative details (e.g., insurance information, consents and authorizations for disclosure) as necessary for the referral.

object.name: CP.4.6#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link to administrative details (e.g., insurance information, consents and authorizations for disclosure) as necessary for the referral.

object.name: CP.4.6#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render administrative details (e.g., insurance information, consents and authorizations for disclosure) as necessary for the referral.

object.name: CP.4.6#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, store and render an inbound referral response (e.g., referral accepted, referral denied or more information needed).

object.name: CP.4.6#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render recommended actions based on an inbound referral response (e.g., referral accepted, referral denied or more information needed).

object.name: CP.4.6#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture a notification that the patient fulfilled a referred appointment.

object.name: CP.4.6#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render diagnosis-based clinical guidelines for making a referral.

object.name: CP.4.6#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine the contents of a referral order by rendering order sets for review by the provider.

object.name: CP.5 Manage Results
object.notes: $ST$Present, annotate, and route current and historical test results to appropriate providers for review. Provide the ability to filter and compare results.$DE$Results of tests are presented in an easily accessible manner to the appropriate providers. For example, flow sheets, graphs, or other tools allow care providers to view or uncover trends in test data over time. In addition to making results viewable, it is often necessary to send results to appropriate providers using electronic messaging systems, pagers, or other mechanisms. In addition, the system may have the ability to redirect or copy specific test results to a specified individual. Documentation of notification is accommodated. Results may also be routed to patients electronically or by letter. Note: “Results” are understood as applying to any type of test, whether biological or psychological.Manage results may enable the provider to communicate with the patient (see function DC.3.2.3 (Provider-Patient Communication)).There may also be a need to notify public health agencies based on the result. See function DC.2.6.1 (Support for Epidemiological Investigations of Clinical Health Within a Population).$EX$

object.name: CP.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage test results in according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.5#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render numerical and non-numerical current and historical test results.

object.name: CP.5#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render results for an identified patient or group of patients.

object.name: CP.5#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render results by factors that supports results management including type of test, critical indicator and abnormal indicator.

object.name: CP.5#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag and render normal and abnormal indictors for results based on data provided from the original data source.

object.name: CP.5#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render numerical results in flow sheets, graphical form or other views that allow comparison of results, and display values graphed over time.

object.name: CP.5#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render results by date/time range including ordered date/time, specimen collection date/time and results received date/time.

object.name: CP.5#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag new results received and render to the relevant providers (ordering, copy to) that new results have been received but not reviewed.

object.name: CP.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture an indicator that a result has been rendered and acknowledged by a user.

object.name: CP.5#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit results to other care providers.

object.name: CP.5#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit results to patients by methods such as phone, fax, electronically or letter.

object.name: CP.5#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit results to an automated callback system.

object.name: CP.5#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and transmit a request for action to another provider(s).

object.name: CP.5#14
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to receive a request for action regarding a result from another provider and capture an acknowledgement of receipt.

object.name: CP.5#15
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render results in clinically logical sections (e.g., Pathology, Chemistry).

object.name: CP.5#16
object.notes: The system SHALL link results to the electronic order if the system contains the electronic order.

object.name: CP.5#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to annotate a result.

object.name: CP.5#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link and render the results report to other data (e.g., images) with which it is associated.

object.name: CP.5#19
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to import and receive preliminary and final result reports from ancillary systems according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.5#20
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to import or receive preliminary and final results as discrete data from ancillary systems according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.5#21
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render preliminary (e.g., "wet read") and final result reports according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.5#22
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag and render a notification to the appropriate health care team member(s) (using role-based alerts) of clinically-significant results or result changes.

object.name: CP.5#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link results to a specific medical condition, medication or therapeutic class of medication.

object.name: CP.5#24
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to link with Radiology Information Systems (RIS) or Picture Archiving & Communication Systems (PACS) to enable the presentation of images.

object.name: CP.5#25
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to link one or more images to a result report.

object.name: CP.5#26
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability annotate a result, THEN the system SHALL render the annotation with subsequent views of that result.

object.name: CP.5#27
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture an annotation from the patient on a result and render the annotation with subsequent views of that result.

object.name: CP.5#28
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag and render a notification that results are received for a patient no longer actively at the facility.

object.name: CP.5#29
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage results of specific genetic tests, genetic markers, or findings according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law and subject to patient's preferences and consent.

object.name: CP.5.1 Manage Results of Diagnostic Tests
object.notes: $ST$Enable the receipt and display of results for diagnostics tests.$DE$Diagnostic test results are received and should be stored and displayed while linked to the original order in the system.$EX$

object.name: CP.5.1#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render diagnostic results, including preliminary as well as final results.

object.name: CP.5.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render microorganism information/descriptions from laboratory results as free-text.

object.name: CP.5.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render microbiology laboratory results (with sensitivity testing) using standard coding methodology according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.5.1#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render laboratory results that identify new and emerging laboratory procedures (e.g., processes that examine emerging organisms, new processes that examine existing organisms).

object.name: CP.5.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render discrete diagnostic results received through an electronic interface.

object.name: CP.5.1#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render indicators of normal and abnormal diagnostic results based on information provided from the original source (e.g., from a laboratory or radiology department).

object.name: CP.6 Manage Treatment Administration
object.notes: $ST$Provide the functionality required to support the management of medication and immunization administration.$DE$Provide the functionality required to support the safe administration of medications or immunizations to a patient based on medical requirement and orders within the system. This includes presenting providers with the list of medications or immunizations that are to be administered to a patient, necessary administration information, and capture all required and relevant administration details.$EX$

object.name: CP.6.1 Manage Medication Administration
object.notes: $ST$Present providers with the list of medications that are to be administered to a patient, necessary administration information, and capture administration details.$DE$In a setting in which medication orders are to be administered by a provider rather than the patient, the necessary information is presented including: the list of medication orders that are to be administered; administration instructions, times or other conditions of administration; dose and route, etc. The system shall securely relate medications to be administered to the unique identity of the patient (see CPS.1.1). Additionally, the provider can record what actually was or was not administered, whether or not these facts conform to the order. Appropriate time stamps for all medication related activity are generated.For some settings that administer complete sets of medications from a variety of providers' orders, it may be useful to provide an additional check for possible drug-drug or other interactions.The EHR system shall support the five “rights” - Right Patient, Right Drug, Right Dose, Right Route, Right Time.The system should report medication administration, where appropriate, to public health or disease management authorities (e.g. oncology related medication orders should be communicated or transmitted to a cancer registry).$EX$

object.name: CP.6.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the list of medications that are to be administered.

object.name: CP.6.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render medications as dispensed (including dose and quantity of dispensed units of medication).

object.name: CP.6.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag the medications that are to be administered by the patient.

object.name: CP.6.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the drug, dose, route, time and frequency of desired administration for all scheduled medications.

object.name: CP.6.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL render ordered administration directions (SIG) for administration of all medications on the list.

object.name: CP.6.1#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a notification to the clinician when specific doses are due.

object.name: CP.6.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a notification when medication related activities are due.

object.name: CP.6.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.1 (Support for Medication Interaction and Allergy Checking) in order to determine and render allergies, drug-drug interactions, and other potential adverse reactions, when rendering medication administration information.

object.name: CP.6.1#09
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.2 (Support for Patient Specific Dosing and Warnings) in order to determine and render other potential adverse reactions, when rendering medication administration information.

object.name: CP.6.1#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain the medication identification number of the drug administered to the patient (e.g., NDC number, lot numbers, expiration date).

object.name: CP.6.1#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render medication administration details as discrete data, including:(1) the medication name, strength and dose;(2) date and time of administration;(3) route and site;(4) administering provider(5) observations, reactions and complications(6) reason medication not given and/or medication related activity not performed; according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.1#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the effectiveness of PRN or “as needed” doses after they have been administered on the electronic record of medication administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render any clinical interventions or assessments required prior to medication administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render any clinical interventions or assessments required subsequent to medication administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to securely link medication-related activities to the unique identity of the patient (e.g., verification of administration to correct patient).

object.name: CP.6.1#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the identification of medication samples dispensed, including lot number and expiration date.

object.name: CP.6.1#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD support integrated point of care devices for patient and medication identification, such as barcode recognition verification of patients and medications.

object.name: CP.6.1#18
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render medication orders that have not been dispensed.

object.name: CP.6.1#19
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render medication orders that have not been administered.

object.name: CP.6.1#20
object.notes: The system SHOULD render an alert, when rendering administration information, if a maximum individual or daily dose exists and further administration would cause these to be exceeded (e.g., in the case of a PRN order with weight-based or BSA-based dose limits).

object.name: CP.6.1#21
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render medications to be administered over a selectable date/time range.

object.name: CP.6.1#22
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the medication administration history including administering clinician, date, and time.

object.name: CP.6.1#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render continuous infusions in a manner that distinguishes them from other discrete-dose medications (e.g. insulin drip versus subcutaneous insulin dose).

object.name: CP.6.1#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render PRN ("as needed") medications in a manner that distinguishes them from other medications.

object.name: CP.6.1#25
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to annotate an individual scheduled medication dose and include the annotation as part of the legal medical record.

object.name: CP.6.1#26
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the medication order as written (i.e., exact clinician order language) when rendering administration information.

object.name: CP.6.1#27
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render patient specific instructions or other free text related to the administration of the medication.

object.name: CP.6.1#28
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage information regarding a second provider witness to co-document administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#29
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the documentation of medication administration using a barcode scanner.

object.name: CP.6.1#30
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render an alert to the administering provider when a barcode and scanner is used to document administration and one of the following is in error: right patient, right medication, right dose, right time and right route or there has not been positive identification of administering provider.

object.name: CP.6.1#31
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage medication administration schedules on the record of medication administration - to allow user to adjust future authorized schedule as needed (e.g., delay, refused, unavailable).

object.name: CP.6.1#32
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a notification to the pharmacy of changes in schedules on the record of medication administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#33
object.notes: The system SHOULD tag that a medication order has been rendered including capturing the date, time and current user credentials.

object.name: CP.6.1#34
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture an acknowledgement from a user that a medication order has been reviewed including capturing the date, time and user credentials.

object.name: CP.6.1#35
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture documentation of medication administration prior to pharmacy review.

object.name: CP.6.1#36
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render as part of the medication administration record for infusions the actual date and times of the infusion including the start and stop times and any modifications to the infusion.

object.name: CP.6.1#37
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain, and render the patient's consent to have restricted medications administered, (e.g. Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS)).

object.name: CP.6.1#38
object.notes: The system MAY auto-populate the medication administration record as a by-product of verification of administering provider, patient, medication, dose, route and time according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.1#39
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain, and present physiological parameters or task completion that must be checked and recorded prior to medication administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#40
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain documentation that the right patient, right medication, right dose, right time, and right route were verified (e.g., using positive ID technology such as bar code scanning) at the time of administration.

object.name: CP.6.1#41
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a medication unique identifier (e.g. Structured Products Label (SPL) in the U.S. Realm).

object.name: CP.6.2 Manage Immunization Administration
object.notes: $ST$Capture and maintain discrete data concerning immunizations given to a patient including date administered, type, manufacturer, lot number, and any allergic or adverse reactions. Facilitate the interaction with an immunization registry to allow maintenance of a patient’s immunization history.$DE$During an encounter, recommendations based on accepted immunization schedules are presented to the provider. Allergen and adverse reaction histories are checked prior to giving the immunization. If an immunization is administered, discrete data elements associated with the immunization including date, type, manufacturer and lot number are recorded. Any new adverse or allergic reactions are noted. If required, a report is made to the public health immunization registry or other organization (e.g. military unit commander, refugee program leadership).$EX$

object.name: CP.6.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render immunization administration details as discrete data, including:(1) the immunization name/type, strength and dose;(2) date and time of administration;(3) manufacturer, lot number, expiration date,(4) route and site of administration;(5) administering provider;(6) observations, reactions and complications;(7) reason immunization not given and/or immunization related activity not performed;according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.2#02
object.notes: The system MAY auto-populate the immunization administration record as a by-product of verification of administering provider, patient, medication, dose, route and time according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.2#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render required immunizations, and when they are due, based on widely accepted immunization schedules, when rendering encounter information.

object.name: CP.6.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, in a discrete field, an allergy/adverse reaction to a specific immunization.

object.name: CP.6.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.3.2 (Manage Patient Clinical Measurements) to capture other clinical data pertinent to the immunization administration (e.g., vital signs).

object.name: CP.6.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link standard codes (e.g. NDC, LOINC, SNOMED or CPT) with discrete data elements associated with an immunization.

object.name: CP.6.2#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to maintain the immunization schedule.

object.name: CP.6.2#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render a patient‘s immunization history upon request for appropriate authorities such as schools or day-care centers.

object.name: CP.6.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.1.2 (Manage Allergy, Intolerance and Adverse Reaction List).

object.name: CP.6.2#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD transmit required immunization administration information to a public health immunization registry according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.2#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD exchange immunization histories with public health immunization registries according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.2#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD harmonize Immunization histories with a public health immunization registry according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CP.6.2#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture and render immunization histories from a public health immunization registry.

object.name: CP.6.2#14
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.1.6 (Manage Immunization List).

object.name: CP.6.2#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update immunization histories at the time of capturing an immunization administration.

object.name: CP.6.2#16
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render the immunization order as written (i.e., exact clinician order language) when rendering administration information.

object.name: CP.6.2#17
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine due and overdue ordered immunizations and render a notification.

object.name: CP.6.2#18
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render a patient educational information regarding the administration (e.g., Vaccine Information Statement (VIS)).

object.name: CP.6.2#19
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture that patient educational information (e.g., VIS) was provided at the time of immunization administration.

object.name: CP.6.2#20
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture documentation that patient educational information (e.g., VIS) was provided at the time of immunization administration.

object.name: CP.6.2#21
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the receiving entity (e.g., patient, representative, organization) when patient education information is provided at the time of immunization administration.

object.name: CP.6.2#22
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain immunization refusal reasons as discrete data.

object.name: CP.6.2#23
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture patient preferences regarding receipt of immunization (e.g. refusal of certain vaccine types) at time of immunization administration.

object.name: CP.7 Manage Future Care
object.notes: $ST$Provide the functionality to manage treatment and care planning through presentation of guidelines and protocols as well as managing recommendations for future care.$DE$The presentation of appropriate guidelines and protocols for future care and the capture and management of recommendations for future care are required to ensure lifetime care of the patient. This includes the management of recommendations for post-encounter care and linkage of recommendations to other components in the health record such as the problem lists and other source documentation.$EX$

object.name: CP.7.1 Present Guidelines and Protocols for Planning Care
object.notes: $ST$Present organizational guidelines for patient care as appropriate to support planning of care, including order entry and clinical documentation.$DE$Guidelines, and protocols presented for planning care may be site specific, community or industry-wide standards. $EX$

object.name: CP.7.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to present current guidelines and protocols to providers who are creating plans for treatment and care.

object.name: CP.7.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a guideline or protocol based on appropriate criteria (such as problem or medication).

object.name: CP.7.1#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render previously used guidelines and protocols for historical or legal purposes.

object.name: CP.7.1#04
object.notes: IF decision support prompts are used to support a specific clinical guideline or protocol, THEN the system SHALL conform to function CPS.3.8 (Manage Documentation of Clinician Response to Decision Support Prompts).

object.name: CP.7.1#05
object.notes: IF the system supports context sensitive care plans, guidelines and protocols, THEN the system SHALL conform to function CPS.3.4 (Support for Context-Sensitive Care Plans, Guidelines, Protocols).

object.name: CP.7.2 Manage Recommendations for Future Care
object.notes: $ST$Document and support the management of the disposition process for a patient by managing recommendations for future care.$DE$Patient encounters or treatments can end in many different states and support for these requires that the EHR support the ability to capture and maintain recommendations for the further future care of the patient. The EHR should accommodate, at a minimum, the following possible recommendations for future care (or dispositions) along with other supporting information for the recommendations:- discharge,- admission, - transfer, - death, - left without being seen (LWBS), - left without treatment (LWOT), - elopements (i.e. leaving without notifying the facility or wandering), - left against medical advice (AMA), - patients triaged to other clinics, & - administrative errors.$EX$

object.name: CP.7.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture recommendations for future care as discrete data elements including the recommending provider and an alert date for the recommendation to take effect.

object.name: CP.7.2#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to maintain recommendations and associated recommendation meta-data (e.g., date of alert).

object.name: CP.7.2#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render an alert of the recommendation based on the date associated with the recommendation.

object.name: CP.7.2#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture recommendations for future care or post-encounter disposition from encounter and diagnostic studies imported in structured documents.

object.name: CP.7.2#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture recommended actions for future care along with the recommending provider, the date recommended and the date suggested to carry out the recommendation.

object.name: CP.7.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link the recommendation for future care with the original documentation of that recommendation.

object.name: CP.7.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link the recommendation with condition(s) on the Problem List.

object.name: CP.8 Manage Patient Education & Communication
object.notes: $ST$Provide the functionality to effectively communicate with the patient regarding their care and document the communication as part of the patient's medical record.$DE$During an encounter with a patient or when any medical decision is made that affects the patient and requires action from the patient it is necessary to communicate effectively with the patient (or their representative) to ensure that they can participate appropriately in their care. this includes providing instructions pertaining to preparation for a procedure, self-administration of medications and self care. $EX$

object.name: CP.8.1 Generate, Record and Distribute Patient-Specific Instructions
object.notes: $ST$Generate and record patient-specific instructions related to pre- and post-procedural and post-treatment/discharge requirements.$DE$When a patient is scheduled for a test, procedure, or discharge, specific instructions about diet, clothing, transportation assistance, convalescence, follow-up with physician, etc., may be generated and recorded, including the timing relative to the scheduled event. In an outpatient scenario, similar instructions for post-diagnosis and/or post-treatment needs may also be generated and recorded (e.g. exercise instructions for low back pain, wound or burn care).$EX$

object.name: CP.8.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render standardized instruction sets pertinent to the patient condition, for procedures, or scheduled events.

object.name: CP.8.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render instructions pertinent to the patient as selected by the provider.

object.name: CP.8.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit instruction information in electronic format to be provided to the patient.

object.name: CP.8.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render as part of patient instructions details on further care such as follow up, return visits and appropriate timing of further care.

object.name: CP.8.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture that instructions were given to the patient.

object.name: CP.8.1#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the actual instructions given to the patient or reference the document(s) containing those instructions.

object.name: CP.8.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to annotate patient specific instructions.

object.name: CP.8.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain, as discrete data, the reason for variation from rule-based clinical messages and patient information.

object.name: CP.8.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage patient instructions in multiple languages.

object.name: CP.8.1#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage a list of appropriate patient instructions based on age.

object.name: CP.8.1#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage a list of appropriate patient instructions based on gender.

object.name: CP.8.1#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage a list of appropriate patient instructions based on diagnosis.

object.name: CP.8.1#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage a list of appropriate patient instructions based on reading level.

object.name: CP.8.1#14
object.notes: The systems MAY provide the ability to render educational materials using alternative modes to accommodate patient sensory capabilities (e.g., vision impairment, hearing impairment).

object.name: CP.9 Manage Care Coordination & Reporting
object.notes: $ST$Provide the functionality required to coordinate care with other providers and report care provided.$DE$During care provision it is necessary to coordinate care with other providers, internal or external to the organization, as well as to communicate the care provided. $EX$

object.name: CP.9.1 Produce a Summary Record of Care
object.notes: $ST$Render a summarized review of a patient's episodic and/or comprehensive EHR, subject to jurisdictional laws and organizational policies related to privacy and confidentiality.$DE$Create summary views and reports at the conclusion of an episode of care. Create service reports at the completion of an episode of care such as, but not limited to, discharge summaries, specialist or consultation reports and public health reports, using information captured in the EHR and without additional input from clinicians.$EX$

object.name: CP.9.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render summaries of the patient's comprehensive EHR that include at a minimum: problem list, medication list, allergy and adverse reaction list, and procedures.

object.name: CP.9.2 Capture Heath Service Report Information
object.notes: $ST$Support the creation of health service reports to authorized health entities that a provider may be required to generate.$DE$Providers are prompted to collect sufficient information in the course of care to avoid duplicate, retrospective or other additional data entry as part of supporting health management programs and reporting, for example public health, such as notifiable condition reports, immunization, cancer registry and discharge data .$EX$

object.name: CP.9.2#01
object.notes: The system MAY render a notification that prompts providers on the data needed for end of encounter reporting during the continuum of care to streamline end of care data collection.

object.name: CP.9.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD render (i.e., create) service reports at the completion of an episode of care (e.g., discharge summaries, public health reports, etc.) using data collected during the encounter.

object.name: CP.9.2#03
object.notes: IF the patient is tagged as deceased, THEN the system MAY provide the ability to capture (i.e., trigger) and render the collection of death certificate data.

object.name: CP.9.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render the acknowledgement that health service reports have been received.

object.name: CP.9.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.9.1 (Produce a Summary Record of Care).

object.name: CP.9.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD render a notification that prompts providers on the information needed for regulatory safety reporting.

object.name: 3 Care Provision Support
object.notes: $OV$The Care Provision Support Section focusses on functions required to support the provision of care to a specific patient to enable hands-on delivery of healthcare. This section is organized generally in alignment with Care Provision Section. For example, CP.4 (Manage Orders) is supported directly by CPS.4 (Support Orders). This alignment is designed to assist in finding related support functions related to care provision functions but is not expected to be 100% matched as some Care Provision Functions do not require matching Support functions or vice-versa.All functions within the Care Provision Support Section have an identifier starting with “CPS”.$EX$$AC$

object.name: CPS.1 Record Management
object.notes: $ST$Manage the patient record including all patient demographics, identifiers and other information to support the provision of care.$DE$Management of the patient record includes creation through quick registration or through a captured referral request as well as managing the patient encounter information linked to the appropriate patient record. It is also critical to manage the patient's relationships through genealogy, insurance, living situation or other means. This section also includes support for the management of patient and family preferences including patient advance directives, consents and authorizations linked to the unique patient record. For those functions related to data capture, data should be captured using standardized code sets or nomenclature, depending on the nature of the data, or captured as unstructured data. Care-setting dependent data are entered by a variety of caregivers. Data may also be captured from devices or other tele-health applications. $EX$

object.name: CPS.1.1 Manage a Patient Record
object.notes: $ST$Manage a single logical record for each patient.$DE$A single record is needed for legal purposes, as well as to organize it unambiguously for the provider. Health information is captured and linked to the patient record. Static data elements as well as data elements that will change over time are maintained. The patient is uniquely identified, after which the record is tied to that patient. Combining information on the same patient, or separating information where it was inadvertently captured for the wrong patient, helps maintain health information for a single patient. In the process of creating a patient record, it is at times advantageous to replicate identical information across multiple records, so that such data does not have to be re-entered. For example, when a parent registers children as new patients, the address, guarantor, and insurance data may be propagated in the children’s records without having to re-enter them.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL manage a single logical record for each patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage a record for a patient when the identity of the patient is unknown.

object.name: CPS.1.1#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag a record when the identity of the patient is unknown.

object.name: CPS.1.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage more than one identifier for each patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.1#05
object.notes: The system SHALL link key identifier information (e.g., system ID, medical record number) to each patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.1#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to uniquely identify a patient and link the record to a single patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to identify a patient by an alias and link the record to a single patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability, through a controlled method, to integrate or link dispersed information for an individual patient upon recognizing the identity of the patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability, when health information has been mistakenly associated with a patient, to tag the information as erroneous in the record of the patient in which it was mistakenly associated and represent that information as erroneous in all outputs containing that information.

object.name: CPS.1.1#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability, when health information has been mistakenly associated with a patient, to associate the health information with the correct patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render parts of a patient record using a primary identifier, secondary identifiers, or other information which are not identifiers, but could be used to help identify the patient.

object.name: CPS.1.1#12
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag as obsolete, inactivated or nullified, to store in archives and to remove a patient's record in accordance with local policies and procedures, as well as applicable laws and regulation.

object.name: CPS.1.1#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to autopopulate identical data to all records of related patients.

object.name: CPS.1.1#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture anonymized patient registration.

object.name: CPS.1.1#15
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to link the mother's and neonate's medical record numbers.

object.name: CPS.1.1#16
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render patient records based on previous names.

object.name: CPS.1.1#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link several patients that have some common demographics.

object.name: CPS.1.2 Manage Patient Demographics
object.notes: $ST$Manage patient demographic information.$DE$Demographic information including names, addresses, phone numbers, date of birth, and gender is managed to support unique patient identification, reporting and the provision of care. Patient demographics are captured and maintained as discrete fields and may be enumerated, numeric or codified according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law. Key patient identifiers (i.e. name and primary patient record identifier) must be shown on all patient information output (e.g. rendering of a patient's record). The system must provide the ability to store multiple patient names in each name field, including any accent marks or special characters. For example: (1) first name: “Mary Jane", middle name: ” Sue", last name: “Smith"; (2) last name: “Smith-Jones".$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture demographic information as discrete data as part of the patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.2#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to maintain demographic information as discrete data as part of the patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.2#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render demographic information as discrete data as part of the patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.2#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage historic information for demographic data including prior names, addresses, phone numbers and email addresses.

object.name: CPS.1.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL render a set of patient identifying information at each interaction with the patient record.

object.name: CPS.1.2#06
object.notes: The system MAY store the demographic information (and other meaningful individual identifiers) separately from clinical data for identity protection purposes.

object.name: CPS.1.2#07
object.notes: The system SHALL capture complete date/time or valid date/time fragments in discrete date/time fields (e.g. 2011/12/31 or 2011/12).

object.name: CPS.1.2#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to enter a partial date/time if the exact date/time of birth or death is unknown (e.g. year/month only).

object.name: CPS.1.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the administrative gender distinct from the clinical gender.

object.name: CPS.1.2#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage multiple active addresses for the patient.

object.name: CPS.1.2#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage multiple active phone numbers for the patient.

object.name: CPS.1.2#12
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the names and contact information for patient's personal representatives (e.g. guardian, surrogate, financial guarantor) and personal relationships (e.g. foster parents, biological parents).

object.name: CPS.1.2#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the date/time of birth, down to the minute, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.1.2#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture patient demographics through integration with hospital systems to facilitate patient registration.

object.name: CPS.1.2#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the patient to annotate demographic data.

object.name: CPS.1.2#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render a patient's age and age units for any given date.

object.name: CPS.1.2#17
object.notes: The system MAY analyze and render potential merge matches for registrations according to organizational policy and rules.

object.name: CPS.1.2#18
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage multiple patient names in each name component field.

object.name: CPS.1.2#19
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage patient names that include any accent marks or special characters.

object.name: CPS.1.2#20
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to link family or group members so that information that is common to all the members can be updated at the same time.

object.name: CPS.1.3 Capture Quick Registration
object.notes: $ST$Capture a registration, either directly entered or received from an external system, without complete supporting demographics, in order to facilitate patient care before the full registration is complete.$DE$The registration process, including the verification of full demographics data, insurance, contact information, etc. is frequently time consuming. To facilitate patient care in emergency situations, the system must be able to register a patient with minimal information in a time critical manner. Examples of situations when this might be necessary include when a patient presents with acute myocardial infarction, a disaster response, or a mass casualty event.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture an expedited registration.

object.name: CPS.1.3#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture registration through integration with an external system (e.g. Hospital ADT) before all identifying data is known.

object.name: CPS.1.3#03
object.notes: The system SHALL capture or determine registration before all identifying data are known, for purposes of emergent patient care. orders and other interoperability needs.

object.name: CPS.1.3#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to harmonize the patient's health record with the information generated during an expedited registration process.

object.name: CPS.1.4 Capture Referral Request
object.notes: $ST$Enable the receipt and processing of referrals from care providers or healthcare organizations, including clinical and administrative details of the referral, and consents and authorizations for disclosures as required.$DE$Incoming referrals may be from physicians' offices, specialists, clinics, Emergency Medical Services (EMS), transfers from other hospitals or emergency departments, nursing homes, etc. When a system receives a referral request the request must be validated against established criteria to determine if it meets the recipient’s requirements and is appropriate. Referrals may be received for patients who do not previously exist in the recipient system and the system must allow for the ability to triage the request and respond to the requestor. If appropriate the system should allow for the creation of a patient record including the capture of clinical and administrative information received with the referral request. The management of information on patients who are inbound to the care setting is an important component of information management. Data must be easily accessible, centrally retrievable, updatable, transportable and reusable. Clinical data from provider to provider is essential to quality coordinated care for patients referred to the care setting. Knowledge of patients who are expected to arrive helps both care setting and administrative staff plan resource use in real time.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture referral(s) from other care provider (s), whether internal or external to the organization.

object.name: CPS.1.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL capture and render the Source of Referral and the Reason for Referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to import or receive electronically referral(s) from other care provider (s), whether internal or external to the organization.

object.name: CPS.1.4#04
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.2.1 (Support Externally Sourced Clinical Documents) to support the capture of referral documents.

object.name: CPS.1.4#05
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.2.2 (Support Externally Sourced Clinical Data) to support the capture of referral data.

object.name: CPS.1.4#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function CPS.2.3 (Support Emergency Medical System Originated Data) to support the capture of referral data.

object.name: CPS.1.4#07
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.2.4 (Support Externally Sourced Clinical Images) to support the capture of referral images.

object.name: CPS.1.4#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to analyze and present recommendations for potential matches between the patient identified in a received referral and existing patients in the system.

object.name: CPS.1.4#09
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to receive an e-referral for a patient that did not previously exist in the system.

object.name: CPS.1.4#10
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the systems SHOULD provide the ability to define a minimum set of required information that must be included in an e-referral to be accepted.

object.name: CPS.1.4#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture administrative details (such as insurance information, consents and authorizations for disclosure) as necessary from a received referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#12
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture clinical details as necessary from a received referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#13
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to present received e-referrals to a user for triage and approval.

object.name: CPS.1.4#14
object.notes: The system MAY conform to function AS.9.2 (Support Financial Eligibility Verification) and display the results of electronic referral eligibility and health plan/payer checking.

object.name: CPS.1.4#15
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system MAY provide the ability to define diagnosis-based requirements for accepting an e-referral to enable system triage of referrals. For example a breast cancer specialist would not want to receive a colon cancer patient referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#16
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the systems MAY provide the ability to define clinical requirements (such as test results) for accepting an e-referral to enable system triage of referrals. For example a breast cancer specialist may require a positive mammogram before accepting the referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#17
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability for a user to create a patient record from information received in the referral.

object.name: CPS.1.4#18
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability for a user to reject a e-referral request

object.name: CPS.1.4#19
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to capture the reason for an e-referral acceptance or rejection.

object.name: CPS.1.4#20
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to transmit to the referring provider the acceptance or rejection of the e-referral request including the reasons provided for acceptance/rejection.

object.name: CPS.1.4#21
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, store and render confirmation of the receipt of an outbound referral response.

object.name: CPS.1.4#22
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to electronically capture referrals, THEN the system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit to the referring provider to request additional information prior to accept/rejection of e-referral request.

object.name: CPS.1.4#23
object.notes: IF the referral includes a transfer of care (complete or partial or temporary), THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to capture the documentation of the transfer of care according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.1.4#24
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to electronically receive and render location data for patients who are en-route to the care setting (e.g. EMS system tracking patient arrival to the Emergency Department).

object.name: CPS.1.4#25
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.6.2 (Manage Healthcare Resource Availability Information) to support the allocation of resources for incoming referred patients.

object.name: CPS.1.4#26
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit to the referring provider a notification that the patient has attended an appointment with the referred to provider.

object.name: CPS.1.5 Manage Patient Encounter
object.notes: $ST$Manage patient encounter information, including tele-health encounters, and support follow-up encounters.$DE$Each encounter of the patient with the healthcare setting needs to be recorded and the information relevant to the distinct encounter managed. This information includes date and time of the encounter, providers involved, location(s), and the reason for the encounter etc. Additionally, follow-up encounters may require prior administrative and clinical information to be determined or captured, maintained and rendered.Tele-health encounters have unique requirements that may also be supported by the system.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage all data necessary to document a patient encounter including the date/time, providers, location and reason for the encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.5#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render a notification that the patient requires a follow-up encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.5#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine or capture administrative information that is required for a follow-up encounter (e.g., co-payments, service location, prior authorization for a chest x-ray).

object.name: CPS.1.5#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain and render administrative information relevant to an encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.5#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine or capture clinical information that is required for a follow-up encounter (e.g. Fasting requirements, pre-medications).

object.name: CPS.1.5#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage all data necessary to document a patient tele-health encounter including the date/time, providers, location and reason for the encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.5#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the complaint, presenting problem or other reason(s)for the visit or encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.5#08
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the primary (most important) reason for visit/encounter from the patient's perspective.

object.name: CPS.1.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture at least two other reasons in addition to the primary reason for the visit/encounter from the patient's perspective.

object.name: CPS.1.5#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render an indication that the patient was referred for the visit or encounter.

object.name: CPS.1.6 Subject to Subject Relationship
object.notes: $ST$Information about the relationships between patients and others facilitate healthcare delivery and appropriate access to health information.$DE$Information regarding relationships between patients and others serve to provide caregivers with an understanding of the patient's environment and support systems. Examples of relationships between patients and others include parent, relative, legal guardian, health care surrogate or payer.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.6.1 Related by Genealogy
object.notes: $ST$Provide information on relationships by genealogy.$DE$Relationships by genealogy may include genetic mother, next of kin, or family members. Appropriate consents must be acquired prior to the collection or use of this information.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.6.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render genealogical relationship information.

object.name: CPS.1.6.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to extract the information needed to identify persons related by genealogy.

object.name: CPS.1.6.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain and render patient consents to enable patient records to be viewed for the purposes of a genealogical family member’s family medical history.

object.name: CPS.1.6.1#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit family history entries to the Personal Health Records (PHRs) of family members according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.1.6.2 Related by Insurance
object.notes: $ST$Support interactions with other systems, applications, and modules to provide information on an insured person's relationships. Examples of relationships include domestic partner, spouse, and guarantor of payment.$DE$Identifying relationship of persons insured under the same insurance plan is important for administrative transactions. $EX$

object.name: CPS.1.6.2#01
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render information regarding patients who are related by insurance plan.

object.name: CPS.1.6.3 Related by Living Situation
object.notes: $ST$Provide information on relationships by living situation. Examples of living situations include college dormitory, military deployment, in same household.$DE$Living situations may be important means for providers to uniquely identify patients or to identify illnesses that may occur within a given proximity.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.6.3#01
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render living situation -related information.

object.name: CPS.1.6.4 Related by Other Means
object.notes: $ST$Provide information on patient relationships that are represented other than by genealogy, insurance or living situation.$DE$Patients relationships are not limited to genealogy, insurance or living situations. Other examples of patient relationships that are relevant to the healthcare or administrative process may include surrogate mother, guardian, a person authorized to see health records, health care surrogate, and persons who may be related by epidemiologic exposure.$EX$

object.name: CPS.1.6.4#01
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render information regarding patients related by employer and work location for purposes of epidemiological exposure and public health analysis and reporting.

object.name: CPS.1.6.4#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render information regarding persons with "Power of Attorney for Health Care" or other persons with the authority to make medical decisions on behalf of the patient.

object.name: CPS.1.6.4#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render information regarding persons related to the patient other than by genealogy, insurance, and/or living situation.

object.name: CPS.1.7 Preferences, Directives, Consents and Authorizations
object.notes: $ST$Capture and manage patient preferences, advance directives, consents and authorizations.$DE$In the Preferences, Directives, Consents and Authorizations functions there are times when actions/activities related to “patients” are also applicable to the patient representative. Therefore, in this section, the term “patient” could refer to the patient and/or the patient’s personal representative (i.e. guardian, surrogate, proxy, health care agent). $EX$

object.name: CPS.1.7#01
