object.notes: $ST$Offer recommendations and options in medication and monitoring on the basis of patient diagnosis, cost, local formularies or therapeutic guidelines and protocols.$DE$The system should list medication options on the basis of practice standards (e.g. cost or adherence to guidelines), a generic brand, a different dosage, a different drug, or no drug (watchful waiting); suggest lab order monitoring as indicated by the medication or the medical condition to be affected by the medication; and support expedited entry of series of medications that are part of a treatment regimen, i.e. renal dialysis, oncology, transplant, etc.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.2.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.4.2.2 (Support for Patient-Specific Dosing and Warnings).

object.name: CPS.4.2.4#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and present recommendations for medication regimens based on findings related to the patient diagnosis.

object.name: CPS.4.2.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and present recommendations for alternative medication treatments on the basis of practice standards, cost, formularies, or protocols.

object.name: CPS.4.2.4#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render recommendations for monitoring (e.g., labs, behaviors, adverse reactions, side effects) as appropriate to a particular medication.

object.name: CPS.4.3 Support for Non-Medication Ordering
object.notes: $ST$Facilitate provider review and validation of order information to make it pertinent, effective and resource-conservative at the point of order entry.$DE$The system assists provider during order entry for therapies, treatments, care, diagnostics and medical supplies and equipment. Support includes, for example: alerts to duplicate orders, missing results or other information required to initiate order, suggested corollary orders, order sets, best practice guidelines, institution-specific order guidelines and patient diagnosis specific recommendations. Also alerts for orders that may be inappropriate or contraindicated for specific patients, for example, X-rays on pregnant women.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and render, at the time of order entry, required order entry components for non-medication orders.

object.name: CPS.4.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL render an alert at the time of order entry if a non-medication order is missing required information.

object.name: CPS.4.3#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD render an alert for orders that may be inappropriate or contraindicated for specific patients at the time of order entry.

object.name: CPS.4.3#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD conform to function AS.9.2 (Support Financial Eligibility Verification) and render an alert, at the time of order entry, if the order is not eligible for coverage.

object.name: CPS.4.3#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render elapsed time parameters for purposes of duplicate order checking.

object.name: CPS.4.3#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link a non-medication order of any type with a related clinical problem(s) and/or diagnosis code(s) and description.

object.name: CPS.4.3#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture, maintain and render meta-data (e.g. ordering provider, and date/time of order).

object.name: CPS.4.3#08
object.notes: The system SHALL capture and maintain information required for pediatric ordering (e.g., age and weight of the child for radiology or lab orders).

object.name: CPS.4.3#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD auto-populate the answers to questions required for diagnostic test ordering from data within the medical record or captured during the encounter.

object.name: CPS.4.3#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to tag certain diagnostic studies that may/should not be repeated within a proscribed period of time and present an indicator at time of ordering.

object.name: CPS.4.3#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render reminders to patients regarding necessary follow up tests based on the prescribed medication (e.g., reminders may be sent manually or automatically via a pre-determined rule).

object.name: CPS.4.3#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and render reminders to the clinicians regarding necessary patient follow up tests based on the prescribed medication.

object.name: CPS.4.3#13
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage the process of order reconciliation according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.4.4 Support Orders for Diagnostic Tests
object.notes: $ST$This function has not been defined and is captured here as a place-holder for potential further development of the Functional Model.$DE$None Defined at this time.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.5 Support Orders for Blood Products and Other Biologics
object.notes: $ST$This function has not been defined and is captured here as a place-holder for potential further development of the Functional Model.$DE$None Defined at this time.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.6 Support for Referrals
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate patient information for referral indicators.$DE$The system assists with patient referrals, including prompting the provider with referral recommendations based on the patient's medical record. When creating the referral order, support is provided in the compilation of relevant clinical and behavioral health results, demographic and insurance information (if available). Standardized or evidence based protocols for workup prior to referral may also be presented.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.6.1 Support for Referral Process
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate referrals within the context of a patient’s healthcare data.$DE$The system assists with patient referrals, including compilation of relevant clinical and behavioral health results, demographic and insurance information (if available). Standardized or evidence based protocols for workup prior to referral may also be presented.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render clinical and administrative data (e.g., insurance information) as part of the referral process.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render test and procedure results with a referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render standardized or evidence based protocols (e.g., AHRQ evidence-based practice guidelines) with the referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render clinical and administrative data, as well as test and procedure results to the referred-to provider.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit clinical and administrative data, as well as test and procedure results to the referred-to provider.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render referral orders with detail adequate for correct routing to the referred-to provider.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and render age appropriate data as part of the referral process (e.g., inclusion of growth chart in pediatric referral).

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture a provider's schedule for receiving referrals.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#09
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture provider schedules for receiving referrals, THEN the system SHALL determine and render available provider based on their schedule at the time of referral order entry.

object.name: CPS.4.6.1#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability transmit a referral to multiple providers.

object.name: CPS.4.6.2 Support for Referral Recommendations
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate patient data and recommend patient referral based on specific criteria.$DE$The system assists evaluation of certain patient conditions which may lead to a recommendation for referral, for example, for smoking cessation counseling if the patient is prescribed a medication to support cessation screening or assessment for behavioral health conditions. Additionally the system may present recommendations based on other orders – for example, an order for Adriamycin, where additional testing such as a MUGA (heart) scan or an Echocardiogram should be completed prior to administration, could result in a recommended referral to radiology and/or cardiology.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.6.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and present recommendations for potential referrals based on diagnosis(es).

object.name: CPS.4.6.2#02
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and present recommendations for potential referrals based on patient condition (e.g., for smoking cessation counseling if the patient is prescribed a medication to support cessation).

object.name: CPS.4.6.3 Support for Electronic Referral Ordering
object.notes: $ST$Enable the transmission of electronic referral orders from the EHR-S.$DE$When a referral order is created in the system, the system should have the ability to compose the referral package, including any supporting clinical and administrative information, and transmit the referral order to the referred-to provider electronically.$EX$

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to export or transmit electronically referral(s), including all supporting clinical and administrative information to other care provider (s), whether internal or external to the organization.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#02
object.notes: The systems SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain a minimum set of required information that must be included in an e-referral to be transmitted.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#03
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture a minimum set of required information that must be included in an e-referral to be transmitted, THEN the system SHALL determine if the minimum set of information is satisfied prior to transmitting an e-referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#04
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture a minimum set of required information that must be included in an e-referral to be transmitted and determines that the minimum set is not satisfied, THEN the system SHALL render prompts to capture missing information prior to transmitting an e-referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture administrative information (e.g., insurance information, consents and authorizations for disclosure) for inclusion in an e-referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture clinical information (e.g., medications, diagnostic results) for inclusion in an e-referral.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#07
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to present e-referrals, including all attached information and capture an e-signature prior to transmission.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture diagnosis-based requirements for sending an e-referral based on the referred-to provider's requirements (e.g., a breast cancer specialist would not want to receive a colon cancer patient referral).

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#09
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture diagnosis-based requirements for sending an e-referral based on the referred-to provider's requirements, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to present those requirements at the time of referral order entry.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#10
object.notes: The systems MAY provide the ability to define clinical requirements (e.g., history, physical exam, Lab or Radiology results) for sending an e-referral based on the referred-to provider's requirements (e.g., a breast cancer specialist may require a positive mammogram before accepting the referral).

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#11
object.notes: IF the system provides the ability to capture clinical requirements for sending an e-referral based on the referred-to provider's requirements, THEN the system SHALL provide the ability to present those requirements at the time of referral order entry.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#12
object.notes: The system SHALL capture and render a electronic acceptance or rejection of an e-referral request.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#13
object.notes: The system SHALL electronically capture and render the reason for an e-referral acceptance or rejection.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#14
object.notes: The system MAY capture a standards-based coded reason (e.g., SNOMED) for an e-referral acceptance or rejection.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture and render an electronic request for additional information from the referred-to provider.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#16
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to amend an e-referral order with additional information.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#17
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to re-export or re-transmit an e-referral, including all supporting clinical and administrative information to another care provider (s), whether internal or external to the organization.

object.name: CPS.4.6.3#18
object.notes: The system MAY conform to function AS.9.2 (Support Financial Eligibility Verification) and display the results of electronic referral eligibility and health plan/payer checking prior to approval of an referral order.

object.name: CPS.5 Support for Results
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate results and notify provider and patient of results within the context of the patient’s healthcare data.$DE$The system assists with result interpretations and notifications including those for, abnormal results, trending of results (such as discrete lab values over time), evaluation of pertinent results at the time of provider order entry (such as evaluation of lab results at the time of ordering a radiology exam), evaluation of incoming results against active medication orders.$EX$

object.name: CPS.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL render alerts for a result that is outside of a normal value range.

object.name: CPS.5#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render trend results.

object.name: CPS.5#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render pertinent results for analysis at the time of order entry (e.g., evaluation of lab results at the time of ordering a radiology exam).

object.name: CPS.5#04
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render the abnormal result value that triggered the display of alerts and flags (e.g., a value to trigger an HH or LL flag).

object.name: CPS.5#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD present alerts for a result that is outside of age specific normal value ranges.

object.name: CPS.5#06
object.notes: The system SHALL tag critical results that have not been acknowledged.

object.name: CPS.5#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render notifications to the providers who participate in the care team when monitored events/parameters indicate irregularities.

object.name: CPS.5#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render notifications to the patient when monitored events/parameters indicate irregularities.

object.name: CPS.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render decision support algorithms based upon results.

object.name: CPS.6 Support Treatment Administration
object.notes: $ST$Alert providers to potential administration errors (such as wrong patient, wrong drug, wrong dose, wrong route and wrong time) in support of safe and accurate medication and immunization administration and support administration workflow.$DE$The system assists in reduction of errors at time of administration and at the point of care by positive patient identification, by checks on drug identification including name, dose, route and designated time of administration. Access to drug monograph information may be provided to allow providers to check details about a drug and enhance patient education. Workflow for administration is supported through prompts and reminders regarding the “window” for timely administration of medications and immunizations.$EX$

object.name: CPS.6.1 Support for Medication Administration
object.notes: $ST$Alert providers to potential administration errors (such as wrong patient, wrong drug, wrong dose, wrong route and wrong time) in support of safe and accurate medication administration and support medication administration workflow.$DE$The system assists in reduction of medication errors at time of administration and at the point of care by positive patient identification, by checks on drug identification including name, dose, route and designated time of administration. Access to drug monograph information may be provided to allow providers to check details about a drug and enhance patient education. Medication administration includes the administration of medication therapies such as chemotherapy. Workflow for medication administration is supported through prompts and reminders regarding the “window” for timely administration of medications.$EX$

object.name: CPS.6.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and render notifications regarding potential administration errors such as wrong patient, wrong drug, wrong dose, wrong route and wrong time as it relates to medication administration at the point of medication administration.

object.name: CPS.6.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render reminders regarding the date/time range for timely administration of medications.

object.name: CPS.6.1#03
object.notes: The system MAY determine and render recommendations for alternative medication administration techniques based on age, developmental stage, weight, physiological status, mental status, educational level, and past physical history of the patient.

object.name: CPS.6.1#04
object.notes: The system MAY conform to function CPS.7.1 (Access Healthcare Guidance) to enable access to external medication guidance (e.g., drug monograph or package insert information).

object.name: CPS.6.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render physiological parameters or task completion that must be checked and recorded prior to medication administration.

object.name: CPS.6.1#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render at the time of medication administration that an alert was triggered during medication ordering.

object.name: CPS.6.1#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and render medication screening alerts from the electronic record of medication administration.

object.name: CPS.6.1#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link to reference information/knowledge resources at the time of medication administration.

object.name: CPS.6.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render relevant laboratory results (e.g., serum creatinine level for medication metabolized by the renal system) during medication ordering or administration.

object.name: CPS.6.2 Support for Immunization Administration
object.notes: $ST$Alert providers to potential administration errors (such as wrong patient, wrong drug, wrong dose, wrong route and wrong schedule) in support of safe and accurate immunization administration and support immunization administration workflow.$DE$The system assists in reduction of medication errors at time of administration by positive patient identification and by checks on immunization identification. Workflow for immunization administration is supported through prompts and reminders regarding the “window” for timely administration of immunizations.$EX$

object.name: CPS.6.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and render notifications regarding potential administration errors such as wrong patient, wrong drug, wrong dose, wrong route and wrong time as it relates to immunization administration at the point of immunization administration.

object.name: CPS.6.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render reminders regarding the date/time range for timely administration of immunizations.

object.name: CPS.6.2#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the date/time range for due/overdue immunization reminders according to scope of practice and jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.6.2#04
object.notes: The system MAY determine and render recommendations for alternative immunization administration techniques based on age, developmental stage, weight, physiological status, mental status, educational level, and past physical history of the patient.

object.name: CPS.6.2#05
object.notes: The system MAY conform to function CPS.7.1 (Access Healthcare Guidance) to enable access to external immunization guidance (e.g., center for disease control immunization recommendations).

object.name: CPS.6.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render physiological parameters or task completion that must be checked and recorded prior to immunization administration.

object.name: CPS.6.2#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render at the time of immunization administration that an alert was triggered during immunization ordering.

object.name: CPS.6.2#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine and render immunization screening alerts from the electronic record of immunization administration.

object.name: CPS.6.2#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to link to reference information/knowledge resources at the time of immunization administration.

object.name: CPS.6.2#10
object.notes: The system SHALL determine and render potential adverse or allergic reactions (based on allergen history and adverse reaction history) for all immunizations when rendering immunization administration information.

object.name: CPS.6.2#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and present recommendations for required immunizations based on patient risk factors.

object.name: CPS.6.2#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to analyze immunization histories for reconciliation.

object.name: CPS.6.3 Support for Safe Blood Administration
object.notes: $ST$Facilitate real-time checks for potential blood administration errors.$DE$To reduce errors at the time of blood product administration, the system assists in positive patient identification, along with checks and alerts regarding blood product to be administered: identification, amount to be delivered, route and time of administration.$EX$

object.name: CPS.6.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL present, at the time of administration, information necessary to correctly identify the patient and accurately administer blood products including patient name, blood product number, amount, route, product expiration date and time of administration.

object.name: CPS.6.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture validation of the correct matching of the patient to the blood product.

object.name: CPS.6.3#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the blood product number, amount, route and time of administration.

object.name: CPS.6.3#04
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.3.2 (Manage Patient Clinical Measurements) and capture the blood pressure, temperature, pulse, respirations of the patient receiving the product.

object.name: CPS.6.4 Support for Accurate Specimen Collection
object.notes: $ST$Facilitate real-time checks to ensure accurate specimen collection.$DE$To ensure specimen collection accuracy, the patient and specimen are positively identified. The provider is notified in real-time of potential collection errors such as wrong patient, wrong specimen type, wrong means of collection, wrong site, and wrong date and time.$EX$

object.name: CPS.6.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render information necessary to correctly identify the patient and accurately identify the specimen to be collected including, but not limited to, patient name, specimen type, specimen source, means of collection, date and time.

object.name: CPS.6.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render variations between the type of specimen order placed and actual specimen collected.

object.name: CPS.6.4#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture the details of specimen collection.

object.name: CPS.6.4#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD render, at the time of specimen collection, information notifying the provider of a variation between the type of specimen order placed and the actual specimen collected.

object.name: CPS.7 Support Future Care
object.notes: $ST$Support for Future Care is necessary to enable the planning of future care according to appropriate healthcare guidelines.$DE$Support for future care includes the provision of clinical decision support through giving access to healthcare guidelines from external sources.$EX$

object.name: CPS.7.1 Access Healthcare Guidance
object.notes: $ST$Provide pertinent information from available evidence-based knowledge, at the point of care, for use in healthcare decisions and care planning.$DE$The information available regarding disease, disease processes, diagnostic testing, pharmaceuticals, treatment patterns and all aspects of healthcare is constantly changing. The practitioner should be able to access a wide variety of sources that provide relevant, accurate information about any given subject. Examples of resources include, but are not limited to evidence on treatment of specific medical conditions, maintenance of wellness, drug or device trials, context-specific information available through online journals, printed resources such as books and specialty organizations resources. For example, when a condition is diagnosed the provider might be directed to relevant resources that give updated clinical research, useful pharmaceutical combinations, surgical techniques, products or other information useful in the management of the specific condition under consideration.$EX$

object.name: CPS.7.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render external evidence-based healthcare recommendations, including documentation of sources.

object.name: CPS.7.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render external evidenced-based documentation appropriate for the care provider to render a timely judgment.

object.name: CPS.7.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render external evidence-based documentation.

object.name: CPS.7.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CPS.3.3 (Support for Standard Care Plans, Guidelines, Protocols).

object.name: CPS.7.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain initiation criteria for Clinical Practice Guidelines (CPGs).

object.name: CPS.7.1#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine candidate patients based upon configured CPG initiation criteria.

object.name: CPS.7.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD render identified patients applicable CPGs to the care giver.

object.name: CPS.7.1#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain knowledge bases or guidelines deployed in an enterprise.

object.name: CPS.8 Support Patient Education & Communication
object.notes: $ST$Support for appropriate communication with the patient or the patient representatives.$DE$Support for patient education and communication is critical to ensure that the patient can appropriately participate in his care. This includes providing access to relevant patient educational materials and reminders from internal and/or external sources.$EX$

object.name: CPS.8.1 Patient Knowledge Access
object.notes: $ST$Provide the ability to access reliable information about wellness, disease management, treatments, peer support groups, public health education materials, and related information that is relevant for a specific patient.$DE$An individual will be able to find reliable information to research a health question, follow up from a clinical visit, identify treatment options, or other health information needs. The information may be linked directly from entries in the health record, or may be accessed through other means such as key word search. The information may be provided as part of the EHR system but may also include patient information from external databases or specific websites.$EX$

object.name: CPS.8.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine and render information about wellness, disease management, treatments, population level health measures, and related information that is relevant for a specific patient.

object.name: CPS.8.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and render information related to a health question directly from data in the health record or other means such as key word search.

object.name: CPS.8.1#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render patient educational information from external sources.

object.name: CPS.8.1#04
object.notes: IF wellness, disease management, peer support group and related information is external-based, THEN the system MAY provide the ability to link to that information.

object.name: CPS.8.2 Patient Education Material Updates
object.notes: $ST$Receive and validate formatted inbound communications to facilitate and/or perform updating of patient education material.$DE$Materials may include information about a diagnosis, recommended diets, associated patient health organizations, or web links to similar educational information. These materials may be provided electronically and may require validation prior to inclusion in the system.$EX$

object.name: CPS.8.2#01
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and update material that may be provided to the patient at the point of care.

object.name: CPS.8.2#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render information that will allow validation of the patient education material prior to update.

object.name: CPS.8.3 Patient Reminder Information Updates
object.notes: $ST$Receive and validate formatted inbound communications to facilitate updating of patient reminder information from external sources such as Cancer or Immunization Registries.$DE$Information from outside groups, such as immunization groups, public health organizations, etc. may periodically send updates to patient care providers. The system should be capable of generating patient reminders based on the recommendations of these organizations. Patient reminders could be provided to patients by a number of means including phone calls, or mail. A record of such reminders may become part of a patient’s record. Examples of reminders could include a recommended immunization, prophylactic guidelines for MVP, patient self-testing for disease, etc.$EX$

object.name: CPS.8.3#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain patient reminders for patients based on the recommendations of public health authorities or disease specific associations.

object.name: CPS.8.3#02
object.notes: The system MAY determine and link patient reminders with patients meeting specific phenotypic criteria such as age, gender, diagnosis, etc.

object.name: CPS.8.3#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient reminders.

object.name: CPS.8.3#04
object.notes: The system MAY automatically determine and render patient reminders for mailing to patients.

object.name: CPS.8.3#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update disease management guidelines and any associated reference material.

object.name: CPS.8.3#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update preventive services/wellness guidelines and any associated reference material.

object.name: CPS.8.4 Support for Communications Between Provider and Patient and/or the Patient Representative
object.notes: $ST$Facilitate communications between providers and patients and/or the patient representatives.$DE$Providers are able to communicate with patients and others, capturing as specified by the business rules the nature and content of electronic communication, or the time and details of other communication.Examples: - When test results arrive, the clinician may wish to email the patient that test result was normal (details of this communication are captured).- A patient may wish to request a refill of medication by emailing the physician.- Patients with asthma may wish to communicate their peak flow logs/diaries to their provider.- Hospital may wish to communicate with selected patients about a new smoking cessation program.- Automated notification regarding annual flu shots$EX$- When test results arrive, the clinician may wish to email the patient that test result was normal (details of this communication are captured).- A patient may wish to request a refill of medication by emailing the physician.- Patients with asthma may wish to communicate their peak flow logs/diaries to their provider.- Hospital may wish to communicate with selected patients about a new smoking cessation program.- Automated notification regarding annual flu shots

object.name: CPS.8.4#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and store documentation of communications between providers and patients and/ or the patient representatives.

object.name: CPS.8.4#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture scanned documents.

object.name: CPS.8.4#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit information between providers and patients or their representative using a secure internet connection.

object.name: CPS.8.4#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage authorizations documentation for family member or patient representative to receive patient related health information.

object.name: CPS.8.4#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD render an alert to providers regarding the presence of communications that originated from the patient or patient representative.

object.name: CPS.8.4#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render an alert to the patient (or patient representative), when the provider receives information or a request from the patient/representative, regarding the provider's unavailability (e.g., vacations) and determine a rerouting of the information or request.

object.name: CPS.8.4#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a notification of events and new treatment options to providers.

object.name: CPS.8.4#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit to the patient or patient representative reminders of events related to their care (e.g., upcoming appointments) as agreed upon by the patient and/or the patient representative.

object.name: CPS.8.4#09
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and transmit information between providers and patient groups.

object.name: CPS.8.4#10
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render notifications, manually and/or automatically, to patients for conditions and results that require follow-up, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law, and to update the patient record with the fact that this was done.

object.name: CPS.8.4#11
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render information (e.g., electronic, paper, CD-ROM) to patients and to update the patient record with the fact that this was done.

object.name: CPS.8.4#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to notify the patient when specific doses are due.

object.name: CPS.8.4#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the provider to authorize transmittal of medication renewal data to an external system and transmittal of a notice to patient via preconfigured notification channel, one of which may be Consumer Health Solution or Personal Health Record, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.8.5 Patient, Family and Care Giver Education
object.notes: $ST$Facilitate access to educational or support resources pertinent to, and usable by, the patient or patient representative.$DE$The provider or patient is presented with a library of educational materials. Material may be made available in the language or dialect understood by the patient or representative. Material should be at the level of the patient or representative’s level of understanding and sensory capability. Special needs are documented. Material may be disseminated via a mode available to and acceptable by the patient e.g., printed, electronically or otherwise. The review of material between the clinician and the patient, and the patient’s understanding of the review, is documented when desired by the clinician. The patient or patient’s representatives are able to obtain educational information independently without formal review with the clinician, if desired.$EX$

object.name: CPS.8.5#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render educational material for medication, health concerns, conditions, and/or diagnosis.

object.name: CPS.8.5#02
object.notes: The system SHALL have the ability to render applicable educational materials to the patient and/or patient representative.

object.name: CPS.8.5#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render multilingual educational material.

object.name: CPS.8.5#04
object.notes: The systems SHOULD provide the ability to render patient educational materials using alternative modes to accommodate patient sensory capabilities.

object.name: CPS.8.5#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to import and/or receive external educational materials.

object.name: CPS.8.5#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to determine the most pertinent educational material, based on the patient health status, condition and/or diagnosis.

object.name: CPS.8.5#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture the identity of the person who received the educational material provided (i.e., the patient or the patient representative).

object.name: CPS.8.5#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture a note to the effect that the educational material was reviewed with the patient and/or patient representative and regarding their comprehension of the material.

object.name: CPS.8.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render educational materials written for various ages and/or reading abilities.

object.name: CPS.8.5#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine age-appropriate and/or reading-ability appropriate educational materials for the patient and/or patient representative.

object.name: CPS.8.5#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render educational material based on the direct choice made by patients and/or patient representatives.

object.name: CPS.8.5#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture appointment scheduling requests from patients.

object.name: CPS.8.6 Communication with Personal Health Record Systems
object.notes: $ST$Statement: Enable and manage communication between EHR Systems and PHR Systems. $DE$With the increasing use of Personal Health Record systems, it is necessary for the EHR-S to appropriately communicate with the PHR to both capture patient information from the PHR and transmit relevant portions of the EHR patient record to the PHR to support patient self care. $EX$

object.name: CPS.8.6#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain documentation of communications between providers/providers EHR-S and the PHR-S.

object.name: CPS.8.6#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture communication originating from the PHR-S (e.g., date, person identification, details of communication).

object.name: CPS.8.6#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture 3rd party (e.g., family member, authorized representative) authorization documentation for the receipt of health information from the PHR-S.

object.name: CPS.8.6#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to exchange communications between providers and PHR-S using a secure internet connection.

object.name: CPS.8.6#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to receive clinical and administrative data (e.g., insurance information) as part of the referral process from a PHR-S.

object.name: CPS.8.6#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD have the ability to transmit clinical, administrative data, and test and procedure results to a PHR-S based on authorization documentation and according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9 Support Care Coordination & Reporting
object.notes: $ST$Support exchange and reporting of information between participants in patient-centered care.$DE$Provide the support necessary to ensure that appropriate communication between providers is possible to coordinate the patient's care including, clinical communication between providers, standard and ad-hoc reporting and information views of the patient record.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.1 Clinical Communication Management and Support
object.notes: $ST$Support exchange of information between participants in patient-centered care as needed, and the appropriate documentation of such exchanges. Support secure communication to protect the privacy of information as required by federal or jurisdictional law.$DE$Healthcare requires secure communications among various participant in the patient's circle of care: patients, doctors, nurses, chronic disease care managers, public health authorities, pharmacies, laboratories, payers, consultants, and etcetera. An effective EHRS supports communication across all relevant participants, reduces the overhead and costs of healthcare-related communications, and provides automatic tracking and reporting. The list of communication participants is determined by the care setting and may change over time. Because of concerns about scalability of the specification over time, communication participants for all care settings or across care settings are not enumerated here because it would limit the possibilities available to each care setting and implementation. However, communication between providers and between patients and providers will be supported in all appropriate care settings and across care settings. Implementation of the EHRS enables new and more effective channels of communication, significantly improving efficiency and patient care. The communication functions of the EHRS will eventually change the way participants collaborate and distribute the work of patient care.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.1#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit secure real-time messaging either automatically or manually.

object.name: CPS.9.1#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render workflow tasks as part of communication to the provider.

object.name: CPS.9.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD have the ability to present an indication that a secure standards-based message has been transmitted or received, and present that message in human readable form.

object.name: CPS.9.1#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD have the ability to transmit a notification to the user when a message has been received from an external source.

object.name: CPS.9.2 Support for Inter-Provider Communication
object.notes: $ST$Support exchange of information between providers as part of the patient care process, and the appropriate documentation of such exchanges. Support secure communication to protect the privacy of information as required by federal or jurisdictional law.$DE$Communication among providers involved in the care process can range from real time communication (for example, communication between a therapist and nurse), to asynchronous communication (for example, consult reports between physicians). Some forms of inter-practitioner communication will be paper based and the EHR-S must be able to produce appropriate documents.The system should provide for both verbal and written communication. These exchanges would include but not be limited to consults, and referrals as well as possible exchanges within the office as part of the provision and administration of patient care (for example, the communication of new information obtained within the office environment during the process of administration of a tetanus shot while the patient is in the exam room).The system should support the creation and acceptance of paper artifacts where appropriate.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and store in the patient record verbal/telephone communication (including verbal orders) between providers including the identification of these providers.

object.name: CPS.9.2#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to integrate scanned documents from providers into the patient record.

object.name: CPS.9.2#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit messages or information in real time.

object.name: CPS.9.2#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit clinical information (e.g., referrals) via secure e-mail or other secure standard electronic means.

object.name: CPS.9.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to transmit (e.g. via e-mail) specific patient data, reports, and accurate, clinically interpretable images to alternate providers/facilities in an emergency situation.

object.name: CPS.9.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive and transmit in a secure manner electronic multi-media data types representing pictures, sound clips, or video as part of the patient record

object.name: CPS.9.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the user to render patient status (e.g., arrival, admission, discharge, death) notification to providers and care managers.

object.name: CPS.9.2#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient status (e.g., arrival, admission, discharge, death) notification to providers and care manager, based on clinical rules.

object.name: CPS.9.2#09
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability for the user to render patient care plans/instructions to providers and care managers when a patient's status has changed.

object.name: CPS.9.2#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render patient care plans/instructions to providers and care managers based on clinical rules when a patient's status has changed.

object.name: CPS.9.2#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render an alert to an originating external provider who has submitted information or a request, about the target internal provider's unavailability (e.g., vacations) and recommend rerouting of the information or request.

object.name: CPS.9.2#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render an alert the originating internal provider who has submitted information or a request, about the target internal provider's unavailability (e.g., vacations) and recommend rerouting of the information or request.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1 Manage Consultation Requests and Responses
object.notes: $ST$Provide a means to capture and manage requests for consultation and responses.$DE$EHR system should support the ability to document and note calls made to physician/provider consultants, as well as their responses. This includes the time of the initial and any subsequent pages or calls, the time and method whereby the consultant responded, as well as the final disposition of the consultation.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain records of consultations by providers other than the attending provider.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture time paged, time responded, and time arrived, as well as final disposition and recommendation of consultations.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture the details of the request for consultation and its responses as discrete data, including timestamps, sufficient for reporting.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#04
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit from within the application, signals for electronic paging and dialing.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD have the ability to present data on consultations which are pending.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#06
object.notes: The system MAY render to the referring provider a notification of the completion of consultations.

object.name: CPS.9.2.1#07
object.notes: The system MAY present estimated time of arrival of consultants.

object.name: CPS.9.2.2 Support for Provider to Professional Communication
object.notes: $ST$Manage communications to professionals (e.g., coroners, medical examiners, law enforcement) for health care events.$DE$Health care providers must be able to provide notifications and associated administrative and/or clinical information to various professional individuals or organizations of specific health care events (e.g., patient deaths, births, gunshot wounds) in order to promote or trigger a workflow. $EX$

object.name: CPS.9.2.2#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and present an alert or notification to the clinician/certifier that notification of healthcare events to appropriate personnel or systems (e.g., medical examiner, coroner, funeral director, law enforcement, vital records organizations) must be done according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.2.2#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and store an indicator of death/fetal death notification to appropriate personnel or systems (e.g., medical examiner, coroner, funeral director, law enforcement, vital records organizations) including the date and time of the notification event, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.2.2#03
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and store an indicator of birth notification to appropriate personnel or systems (e.g., general practitioner, vital records organization) including the date and time of the notification event, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.2.2#04
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render clinical details regarding birth, death and/or fetal death events to appropriate personnel or systems according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.2.2#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render administrative details regarding birth, death and/or fetal death events to appropriate personnel or systems according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3 Support for Provider -Pharmacy Communication
object.notes: $ST$Provide features to enable secure bi-directional communication of information electronically between practitioners and pharmacies or between practitioner and intended recipient of pharmacy orders.$DE$When a medication is prescribed, the order is routed to the pharmacy or other intended recipient of pharmacy orders. This information is used to avoid transcription errors and facilitate detection of potential adverse reactions. If there is a question from the pharmacy, that communication can be presented to the provider with their other tasks. In certain environments, medication order creation is a collaborative process involving the prescriber and facility staff. Accordingly, this function applies to communication process between the prescriber, facility and the pharmacy or other intended recipient of pharmacy orders. The transmission of prescription data between systems should conform to realm acceptable messaging standards. Informative examples:- HL7 Clinical Document Architecture Release 2- ISO/EN 13606 Electronic Health Record Communication- CEN ENV 13607:2000. Health informatics. Messages for the exchange of information on medicine prescriptions- X12N healthcare transactions- US realm: National Council for Prescription Drug Programs (NCPDP)- Canadian realm: National Electronic Claims Standard (NeCST)$EX$- HL7 Clinical Document Architecture Release 2- ISO/EN 13606 Electronic Health Record Communication- CEN ENV 13607:2000. Health informatics. Messages for the exchange of information on medicine prescriptions- X12N healthcare transactions- US realm: National Council for Prescription Drug Programs (NCPDP)- Canadian realm: National Electronic Claims Standard (NeCST)

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL conform to function CP.4.2 (Manage Medication Orders) and provide the ability to transmit medication orders.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#02
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the prescriber/provider with the ability to electronically transmit orders, prescriptions, eligibility inquiries, acknowledgements and renewal responses to the pharmacy, as necessary, to initiate, change, or renew a medication order.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to receive any acknowledgements, prior authorizations, renewals, inquiries and fill notifications provided by the pharmacy or other participants in the electronic prescription process.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to receive from and transmit to pharmacies clinical information using current realm-specific messaging standards.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability for providers and pharmacies to receive and transmit clinical information via secure e-mail or other electronic means, on both general and specific orders.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to receive and transmit secure real-time messages.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to transmit information on workflow tasks as part of communication to the provider.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to transmit a request to the pharmacy (based on an existing order) that additional medication be delivered (i.e. re-supply request).

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD have the ability to receive and transmit drug utilization review (DUR) findings and formulary & benefits (F&B) data with the pharmacy using standards-based messaging.

object.name: CPS.9.2.3#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture authorization for transmittal of medication renewal data to an external system and transmittal of a notice to patient via preconfigured notification channel, one of which may be Consumer Health Solution or Personal Health Record, according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.3 Health Record Output
object.notes: $ST$Support the definition of the formal health record, a partial record for referral purposes, or sets of records for other necessary disclosure purposes.$DE$Provide hardcopy and electronic output that fully chronicles the healthcare process, supports selection of specific sections of the health record, and allows healthcare organizations to define the report and/or documents that will comprise the formal health record for disclosure purposes. A mechanism should be provided for both chronological and specified record element output. This may include defined reporting groups (i.e. print sets). For example Print Set A = Patient Demographics, History & Physical, Consultation Reports, and Discharge Summaries. Print Set B = all information created by one caregiver. Print Set C = all information from a specified encounter. An auditable record of these requests and associated exports may be maintained by the system. This record could be implemented in any way that would allow the who, what, why and when of a request and export to be recoverable for review. The system has the capability of providing a report or accounting of disclosures by patient that meets in accordance with scope of practice, organizational policy and jurisdictional law.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.3#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render reports consisting of all and part of an individual patient’s record according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: CPS.9.3#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain the records or reports that are considered the formal health record for disclosure purposes.

object.name: CPS.9.3#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render reports in both chronological and specified record elements order.

object.name: CPS.9.3#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to maintain and render hardcopy and electronic report summary information (e.g., procedures, medications, labs, immunizations, allergies, vital signs).

object.name: CPS.9.3#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and maintain reporting groups (i.e., print sets) for specific types of disclosure or information sharing.

object.name: CPS.9.3#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient identifying information on each page of reports generated.

object.name: CPS.9.3#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update reports to match mandated formats.

object.name: CPS.9.3#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a report that includes the point of record metadata for disclosure purpose.

object.name: CPS.9.3#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage-data-visibility [redact] (remove from view and/or output) data elements or portions of a report to prevent the recipient from seeing certain data.

object.name: CPS.9.3#10
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render {cite] the reasons for redaction.

object.name: CPS.9.3#11
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render {reproduce} a copy of the redacted document/record (e.g., through rules, storing a copy).

object.name: CPS.9.3#12
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render patient care events sorted or configured by date and time ranges and data/record type.

object.name: CPS.9.3#13
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to maintain a record of disclosure/release that includes the recipient, and outbound content.

object.name: CPS.9.3#14
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render wrist bands that include appropriate demographic and clinical information.

object.name: CPS.9.3#15
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a record summary using the format specified by an organization to which a patient is transferred.

object.name: CPS.9.4 Standard Report Generation
object.notes: $ST$Provide report generation features using tools internal or external to the system, for the generation of standard reports.$DE$Providers and administrators need access to data in the EHR-S for clinical, administrative, financial decision-making, audit trail and metadata reporting, as well as to create reports for patients. Many systems may use internal or external reporting tools to accomplish this (such as Crystal Report). Reports may be based on structured data and/or unstructured text from the patient's health record.Users need to be able to sort and/or filter reports. For example:-the user may wish to view only the diabetic patients on a report listing patients and diagnoses-the user may wish to view only male patients over 35 with a complaint of chest pain.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.4#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render reports of structured clinical and administrative data using either internal or external reporting tools.

object.name: CPS.9.4#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to extract unstructured clinical and administrative data for inclusion in the report generation process, using internal or external tools.

object.name: CPS.9.4#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to extract and transmit reports generated.

object.name: CPS.9.4#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain report parameters, based on patient demographic and/or clinical data, which would allow sorting and/or filtering of the data.

object.name: CPS.9.4#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to save report parameters for generating subsequent reports either as integrated component of the system, or an external application, using data from the system.

object.name: CPS.9.4#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to edit one or more parameters of a saved report specification when generating a report using that specification either as integrated component of the system, or an external application, using data from the system.

object.name: CPS.9.4#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render automated reports as required by industry and regulatory bodies.

object.name: CPS.9.4#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to extract facility level data at an organizational level in support of organizational initiatives.

object.name: CPS.9.4#09
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a cumulative directory of all personnel who use or access the data.

object.name: CPS.9.5 Ad Hoc Query and Rendering
object.notes: $ST$Provide support for ad hoc query and report generation using tools internal or external to the system. Present customized views and summarized information from a patient's comprehensive EHR subject to jurisdictional laws and organizational policies related to privacy and confidentiality. The view may be arranged chronologically, by problem, or other parameters, and may be filtered or sorted.$DE$Providers and administrators need to respond quickly to new requirements for data measurement and analysis. This may be as a result of new regulatory requirements or internal requirements. This requires that users be able to define their own query parameters and retain them. The data may be found in both structured and unstructured data. Providers and administrators also need to query for the absence of specific clinical or administrative data. For example, the Quality Control department may be reviewing whether or not the protocol for management of Diabetes Mellitus is being followed. If the protocol calls for fasting blood sugars every 3 months at minimum, the investigator might need to run an across-patient query locating patients with diabetes who do not show an FBS result within the last 3 months. Emergency Department benchmarking reports - Key point of time include arrival time; treatment area entrance time, MD contact time; decision to admit, discharge or transfer time; and departure (left ED) time. Important intervals include, but are not limited to the “door to doctor time”, “doctor to diction time”, “admission to bed availability or departure” as well as overall length of stayA key feature of an electronic health record is its ability to support the delivery of care by enabling prior information to be found and meaningfully displayed. EHR systems should facilitate search, filtering (e.g. filtering by key word, tagged data, or diagnosis), summarization, and presentation of available data needed for patient care. Systems should enable views to be customized, for example, specific data may be organized chronologically, by clinical category, by consultant, depending on need. The views may be arranged chronologically, by problem, or other parameters, and may be filtered or sorted. Jurisdictional laws and organizational policies that prohibit certain users from accessing certain patient information must be supported.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.5#01
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render ad hoc query and reports of structured clinical and administrative data through either internal or external reporting tools.

object.name: CPS.9.5#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and render information extracted from unstructured clinical and administrative data in the report generation process, using internal or external tools.

object.name: CPS.9.5#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to extract and transmit reports generated.

object.name: CPS.9.5#04
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain report parameters, based on patient demographic and/or clinical data, which would allow sorting and/or filtering of the data.

object.name: CPS.9.5#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to save report parameters for generating subsequent reports.

object.name: CPS.9.5#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to edit one or more parameters of a saved report specification when generating a report using that specification.

object.name: CPS.9.5#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render reports, using internal or external reporting tools, based on the absence of a clinical data element (e.g., a lab test has not been performed in the last year).

object.name: CPS.9.5#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability for the patient to render {query} the financial data and the data about his or her health related accounts.

object.name: CPS.9.5#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present and transmit customized views of summarized information based on sort and filter controls for date or date range, problem, or other clinical parameters.

object.name: CPS.9.5#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to present and transmit summarized information through customized views based on prioritization of chronology, problem, or other pertinent clinical parameters.

object.name: CPS.9.5#11
object.notes: The system SHALL support the ability for a provider to capture and maintain filters to search for previous events (e.g., encounters, reports, consults) meeting specified criteria.

object.name: CPS.9.6 Information View
object.notes: $ST$Support user-defined information views.$DE$Views of the information can be tailored for or by the user (or department or "job classification”) for their presentation preferences, within local or facility established rules. For example, a nursing supervisor may elect or prefer to see summary data on all patients as the default view.$EX$

object.name: CPS.9.6#01
object.notes: The system MAY provide administrators the ability to capture preferences (e.g., by user, role or context) for rendering information.

object.name: CPS.9.6#02
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture a user's preference for rendering information.

object.name: CPS.9.6#03
object.notes: The system MAY manage role-based data-capture-options.

object.name: CPS.9.6#04
object.notes: The system MAY manage role-based data-rendering-options.

object.name: CPS.9.6#05
object.notes: The system MAY provide authorized users the ability to tailor their presentation of information according to personal preferences according to organizational policy.

object.name: 4 Population Health Support
object.notes: $OV$The Population Health Support Section focuses on those functions required of the EHR to support the prevention and control of disease among a group of people (as opposed to the direct care of a single patient), usually with something(s) in common, e.g., reside in the U.S., have diabetes, are under the age of 5, are treated by the same care provider, have pneumonia and are in a long-term care facility, etc. This section includes functions to support input to systems that perform medical research, promote public health, & improve the quality of care at a multi-patient level. Population health data must be managed carefully to avoid inadvertently breaching patient privacy and confidentiality. Individual patients may be identifiable within a population or aggregate based on information other than patient identifiers, e.g., age plus location, and/or based on a combination of public and population-based information. This section specifically addresses requirements related to patient privacy and consent for use of patient information for secondary uses and/or reporting. All functions within the Population Health Support Section have an identifier starting with “POP”.$EX$$AC$

object.name: POP.1 Support for Health Maintenance, Preventive Care and Wellness
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate patient information to provide alerts, notifications and reminders regarding health, preventative care and wellness.$DE$The system assists in determining ongoing and pertinent communications from the provider to patient to promote health, prevention and wellness.$EX$

object.name: POP.1.1 Present Alerts for Preventive Services and Wellness
object.notes: $ST$Identify patient specific suggestions/reminders, screening tests/exams, and other preventive services in support of routine preventive and wellness care.$DE$At the time of an encounter, the provider or patient is presented with due or overdue activities based on protocols for preventive care and wellness. Examples include routine immunizations, adult and well child care, age and gender appropriate screening exams, such as PAP smears.$EX$

object.name: POP.1.1#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage criteria for disease management, wellness, and preventive services based on patient demographic data (minimally age and gender).

object.name: POP.1.1#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain the rules or parameters upon which guideline-related alerts are based.

object.name: POP.1.1#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage criteria for disease management, wellness, and preventive services based on clinical data (e.g., problem/diagnosis list, current medications).

object.name: POP.1.1#04
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render alerts based on recognized-standard guidelines and/or locally-defined standard guidelines.

object.name: POP.1.1#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render a list of all alerts along with the scheduled date and time for the preventive care and wellness.

object.name: POP.1.1#06
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to render a history of all alerts that were generated for the patient in the record.

object.name: POP.1.1#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain reasons disease management or preventive services/wellness prompts were overridden.

object.name: POP.1.1#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain documentation that a preventive or disease management service has been performed based on activities documented in the record (e.g., vitals signs taken).

object.name: POP.1.1#09
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain documentation that a disease management or preventive service has been performed with associated dates or other relevant details recorded.

object.name: POP.1.1#10
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain, and render alerts to individual patients regarding their specific clinical situation.

object.name: POP.1.1#11
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine when the patient 's monitored health parameters have exceeded threshold values according to scope of practice and/or organizational policy and transmit an alert to a patient's provider or to the patient's care-team.

object.name: POP.1.1#12
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render notifications regarding drug-drug interaction(s) to the patient's provider or to the patient's care-team when changes are made to a population health decision support rule set according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.1.1#13
object.notes: The system SHOULD determine and render notifications regarding drug-drug interaction(s) to the patient's provider or to the patient's care-team when relevant clinical information changes (e.g., new clinical data from an internal or external source) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.1.1#14
object.notes: IF the system determines that applicable tasks and pre-conditions expected have not been performed, THEN the system SHOULD transmit a notification to a patient's provider or to the patient's care-team according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.1.2 Present Notifications and Reminders for Preventive Services and Wellness
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate and notify patient and/or provider of those preventive services, tests, or behavioral actions that are due or overdue.$DE$The system generates notifications to patients regarding activities that are due or overdue. Examples include but are not limited to time sensitive patient and provider notification of follow-up appointments, laboratory tests, immunizations or examinations. The notifications can be customized in terms of timing, repetitions and administration reports. For example, a PAP test reminder might be sent to the patient two months prior to the test being due, repeated at three month intervals, and then reported to the administrator or clinician when nine months overdue.$EX$

object.name: POP.1.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL capture, maintain, and render timely notifications to patients and/or appropriate providers of services, tests or actions that are due or overdue on an individual patient.

object.name: POP.1.2#02
object.notes: The system SHOULD capture in the patient's record a history of system notifications regarding that patient.

object.name: POP.1.2#03
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to determine and present overdue preventive services.

object.name: POP.1.2#04
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture, maintain, and render configuration parameters regarding patient notifications (e.g., number of repetitions of the notification, timing of the notification, escalation in priority).

object.name: POP.1.2#05
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to update content of notifications, guidelines, reminders and associated reference materials.

object.name: POP.1.2#06
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to manage the guidelines, criteria or rules that trigger the reminders.

object.name: POP.1.2#07
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to manage the timing of escalations of notifications and reminders (e.g., escalation from notice, to reminder, to urgent alert).

object.name: POP.1.2#08
object.notes: The system MAY provide the ability to capture and maintain the documentation of manual outreach activities (e.g., e-mail, letter or associated telephone conversation).

object.name: POP.1.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to transmit a notification to an external system (e.g., an external Client Registry or a Personal Health Record System) that a patient’s demographic information was modified.

object.name: POP.2 Support for Epidemiological Investigations of Clinical Health Within a Population
object.notes: $ST$Evaluate cohort-related information based on conditions, trends and other criteria.$DE$The system assists in assessing patient and population health conditions subject to public health reporting. Public health reporting involves sharing a broad range of specified data for a cohort, i.e., a subpopulation defined by behavioral, demographic, environmental and/or health condition characteristic(s), e.g., smokers with lung disease, adults with asthma, students at XYZ Elementary School with measles, diabetics with out-of-range disease markers, etc. By examining data of a given cohort, public health experts can monitor health-related trends; evaluate behavioral, socio-economical, occupational, and other impacts on health; and identify potential outbreaks and associated risk factors, e.g., a cohort of patients with measles can be examined for a common (implied) exposure, such as attending the same school; a cohort of bakers can be examined for a higher-than-expected prevalence of asthma.$EX$

object.name: POP.2#01
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage aggregates based on user-identified criteria (e.g., based on demographic or clinical information) according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.2#02
object.notes: The system SHALL render relevant aggregate-level and/or person level data according to privacy and confidentially rules (to prevent identification of individuals to unauthorized parties).

object.name: POP.2#03
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to tag a set of records using combinations of selected demographic and/or clinical information to create an aggregate or cohort.

object.name: POP.2#04
object.notes: The system MAY conform to TI.5.3 (Standards-Based Application Integration) to support statistical analysis of population-based information.

object.name: POP.2#05
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture and maintain the requestors' format for a report using a recognized-standard or a locally-defined standard.

object.name: POP.2#06
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render person-level lists and aggregate data in the form of public health and/or population-based reports for external use according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.2#07
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to render patient-level lists and aggregate data in the form of public health and/or population-based reports for external use and include metadata that specify its use and/or reuse according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law (e.g., the metadata may indicate that the report is intended for initial, confirmatory or other analyses).

object.name: POP.2#08
object.notes: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture and maintain report definitions for later use.

object.name: POP.2#09
object.notes: The system SHALL provide the ability to render aggregate and person-level data to pre-existing statistical packages according to scope of practice, organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

object.name: POP.2#10
object.notes: IF biosurveillance or other epidemiological investigations require standardized transmission of data to/from a registry or directory, THEN the system SHALL conform to function TI.3 (Registry and Directory Services).

object.name: POP.2.1 Support for Epidemiological Investigations of Clinical Health Within a Population (Aggregate Level)
